1863.description: A Resolution Celebrating The Historic Life And Legacy Of The Honorable Hiram Rhodes Revels As The First African American To Serve In Congress As A United States Senator.

1864.title: Hibbett Neel; honor his illustrious career and philanthropic contributions to our community and wish him continued success.
1864.description: A Resolution Honoring The Illustrious Professional Career Of Mr. Hibbett Neel And Commending Him For His Philanthropic Contributions To The State And The Southern Region.

1865.title: Gulfport High School Lady Admirals Soccer Team; commend for winning MHSAA Class 6A Soccer State Championships.
1865.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2019-2020 Gulfport High School Lady Admirals Soccer Team, Head Coach Chris Pryor And Assistant Coaches Judy Riley, Kelsey Myrick And Emily Weems For Their Undefeated Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Girls Soccer State Championship.

1866.description: A Resolution Congratulating Mrs. Alice Thomas-tisdale Upon Being Named The Publisher Emeritus Of The Jackson Advocate After 38 Years Of Dedicated And Meritorious Service.

1867.title: Billy Ray Reynolds; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1867.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Billy Ray Reynolds And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1868.title: Lieutenant Beverly Davis Prentiss; mourn loss and commend life and legacy of.

1883.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Heroism Of Everyday Heroes Mr. Edward Walker And Mr. Leonard Clay, Who Helped Save The Lives Of Two Gentlemen In Their Community In Urgent Need Of Help, And Extending Best Wishes For Continued Recovery For Mr. Otis Robertson And Mr. Elliott.

1885.title: Carrie Lee Jones Miller; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
1885.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Carrie Lee Jones Miller And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1886.title: Coach Lonnie Walker; commend the life and legacy upon his passing.
1886.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Coach Lonnie Walker.

1887.title: Dr. Jason and Mrs. Cynthia Coleman; commend for their humanitarian efforts to feed and provide shelter to victims of North Mississippi storms.
1887.description: A Resolution Commending The Philanthropic Efforts Of Dr. Jason And Mrs. Cynthia Coleman For Opening Their Home For Storm Victims Throughout North Mississippi Whose Homes And Lives Were Ravaged.

1888.title: Colonel Carlyle Smith "Smitty" Harris; commend service and heroism as a POW of the Vietnam War.
1888.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Distinguished Legacy Of Selfless Patriotism And Heroism Of Retired United States Air Force Colonel Carlyle Smith "smitty" Harris, Rendered To The United States As An American Prisoner Of War During The Vietnam War.

1889.title: Republic of China (Taiwan) and Mississippi; encourage further economic ties and friendship between.
1889.description: A Resolution Encouraging Further Economic Ties And Friendship Between The State Of Mississippi And The Republic Of China (taiwan).

1890.title: Simpson Academy Boys Basketball Team; commend upon winning the 2020 MAIS Overall State Basketball Championship.
1890.description: A Resolution Commending The 2019-2020 Simpson Academy Cougars Boys Basketball Team Upon Winning The 2020 Mais Overall State Basketball Championship, For The First Time In School History.

1891.title: Mr. Cortez Bryant; commend on his outstanding career as a manger for A-list music artists.
1891.description: A Resolution Commending Mr. Cortez Bryant On His Outstanding Career As A Business Manager, Business Owner And Creative Director For A-list Music And Movie Artists.

1892.title: Jefferson County High School Football Team; commend for winning the MHSAA Class 3A District 7 football championship.
1892.description: A Resolution Commending The Jefferson County High School Tigers Football Team And Head Coach James Herrington For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 3a District 7 Football Championship.

1893.title: Mrs. Elletha M. Lewis; commend and express sympathy upon her passing.
1893.description: A Resolution Commending The Life Of Mrs. Elletha M. Lewis And Expressing Deep Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1894.title: Mr. Henry Dorsey; recognize and commend for his career of more than 44 years as an esteemed educator.
1894.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending Mr. Henry Dorsey For His Career Of More Than 44 Years As An Esteemed Educator.

1895.title: Sales and Marketing Pine Belt Pinnacle Awards; commend on 10th anniversary.
1895.description: A Resolution Commending The 10th Anniversary Of The Sales And Marketing Professionals Pine Belt Pinnacle Awards And Its Distinguished 2020 Honorees.

1896.title: Bernice Linton Event Award; commend establishment of.
1896.description: A Resolution Commending Sales And Marketing Professionals Pine Belt For Establishing The Bernice Linton Event Award.

1897.title: Taiwan; commend for donating 100,000 medical face masks to the State of Mississippi.
1897.description: A Resolution Commending The Government Of Taiwan For Donating 100,000 Medical Face Masks To The State Of Mississippi And Encouraging Further Economic Ties And Friendship.

1898.title: Jackie Ray Slater; commend upon being a Jackson State University Alumnus enshrined in the profootball Hall of Fame.
1898.description: A Resolution Commending The Athleticism And Nfl Career Success Of Jackie Ray Slater And Recognizing Him As One Of The Legendary Football Players Of Jackson State University To Be Inducted Into The National Football League's Hall Of Fame.

1899.title: William David Martin; commend life and legacy of service upon his passing.
1899.description: A Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mr. William David Martin, Paramedic With American Medical Response Of Southwest Mississippi, Who Lost His Battle With Covid-19 On Wednesday, April 22, 2020, And Expressing Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1900.title: Lemuel Joseph "Lem" Barney; commend upon being inducted into the NFL Hall of Fame.
1900.description: A Resolution Commending The Athleticism And Nfl Career Success Of Lemuel Joseph "lem" Barney And Recognizing Him As One Of The Legendary Football Players Of Jackson State University To Be Inducted Into The National Football League's Hall Of Fame.

1901.title: West Harrison High School Cheerleader Team; commend upon winning MHSAA 6A State Championship.
1901.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The West Harrison High School Cheerleader Team Upon Winning The 2019 Class 6a State Championship For Varsity Co-ed Game Day Division.

1902.title: Ms. Blakely Fore; commend upon being an Extraordinary Educator for 2020 by Curriculum Associates.
1902.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Blakely Fore Of Gulfport, Mississippi, For Being Named An Extraordinary Educator For 2020 By Curriculum Associates.

1903.title: Mrs. Cathy Anderson; commend upon being named an Extraordinary Educator for 2020 by Curriculum Associates.
1903.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Cathy Anderson Of Columbia, Mississippi, For Being Named An Extraordinary Educator For 2020 By Curriculum Associates.

1904.title: Mr. Larry Edward Duncan; commend upon being an Extraordinary Educator for 2020 by Curriculum Associates.
1904.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Larry Edward Duncan Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, For Being Named An Extraordinary Educator For 2020 By Curriculum Associates.

1905.title: Mr. Jack and Mrs. Betty Quick; commend upon occasion of 70th anniversary.
1905.description: A Resolution Commending Mr. Jack Quick And Mrs. Betty Quick Upon The Occasion Of Their 70th Anniversary And Congratulating Mrs. Quick Upon The Occasion Of Her 90th Birthday.

1906.title: Chief Steve Coker; commend upon 28 years of service in the fire industry and upon his retirement as New Albany's Fire Chief.
1906.description: A Resolution Commending The Outstanding Career Of Mr. Steve Coker Upon The Special Occasion Of His Retirement As New Albany's Fire Chief And For 28 Years Of Service In The Fire Industry.

1907.title: Raymond O'Neal Grogan Jr.; commend upon retirement in law enforcement.
1907.description: A Resolution Commending Mr. Raymond O'neal Grogan, Jr., Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement In Law Enforcement.

1908.title: Dr. Estus Smith; commend his life and legacy upon his passing.
1908.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Estus Smith And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1909.title: Louis Benjamin Beverly, Jr.; commend his life and legacy upon his passing.
1909.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Louis Benjamin Beverly, Jr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1910.title: Esther Martin Rigsby; commend life upon passing.
1910.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Esther Martin Rigsby And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1911.title: Judge Andrew K. Howorth; commend upon retirement as Third Circuit Court Judge.
1911.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service That The Honorable Judge Andrew K. Howorth Provided As The Circuit Court Judge Of The Third Circuit Court District Of Mississippi Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1912.title: Judge John A. Gregory; commend upon retirement.
1912.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Distinguished Legal Career And Public Service Of Third District Circuit Judge John A. Gregory, Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1913.title: JSU Athletic Director Ashley Robinson; commend for being the first African American President of FSC ADA.
1913.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Mr. Ashley Robinson, Vice President And Director Of Athletics At Jackson State University, As The First African American Selected As President Of The Division I Football Championship Subdivision Athletics Directors Association.

1914.title: Chief Brian Ray Grissom; commend distinguished career upon the occasion of his retirement as Fire Chief for Iuka Fire Department.
1914.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Meritorious Firefighter Career Of Iuka Fire Chief Brian Ray Grissom Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1915.title: Coach Tiffany Murray; commend for establishing the Lion's Den clothes closet for students at Lyman Elementary School.
1915.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending Coach Tiffany Murray For Establishing The Lion's Den Clothes Closet For Students At Lyman Elementary School.

1916.title: Gloria Jennings Purnell; commend esteemed career with the MS House of Representatives upon the occasion of her retirement.
1916.description: A Resolution Commending The Esteemed Career And Public Service Of Mrs. Gloria Jennings Purnell Rendered To The Citizens Of Mississippi As Assistant Clerk, Responsible For Journal And Message Clerk Duties For The Mississippi House Of Representatives, And Congratulating Her Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement.

1917.title: Jack and Jill of America, Inc.; commend for outstanding service.
1917.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending Jack And Jill Of America, Inc., For Its Outstanding Service To The State Of Mississippi And The United States Of America.

1918.title: Thomas "Snacks" Lee; commend upon winning the 2020 "Can't-Stop-Watching Moment" ESPY Award.
1918.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Jackson State University Basketball Team Student Manager Thomas "snacks" Lee For His Amazing Shot And For Winning The 2020 Espy Award For The "can't-stop-watching Moment."

1919.title: Governor-Elect Tate Reeves; appoint a joint committee of the House and Senate to arrange inauguration of.
1919.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For The Appointment Of A Joint Committee Of The Legislature To Arrange For The Inauguration Of Governor-elect Tate Reeves.

1920.title: Joint Session; provide for the inauguration of and to hear the message of Governor Tate Reeves.
1920.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The House Of Representatives And The Senate On January 14, 2020, For The Inauguration Of And To Hear The Message Of Governor Tate Reeves.

1921.title: State of the State of the Governor; call joint session to hear.
1921.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Tate Reeves.

1922.title: Alcorn State University "Braves" Football Team; commend upon winning the 2019 Southwestern Athletic Conference championship.
1922.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Alcorn State University "braves" Football Team Upon Their Outstanding 2019 Season And For Winning The Swac Football Championship.

1923.title: Fannie Lou Hamer; request the Joint Committee on the Library of Congress to approve the replacement of the statue of James Zachariah George with statue of.
1923.description: A Concurrent Resolution Formally Requesting The Joint Committee On The Library Of Congress To Approve The Replacement Of The Statue Of James Zachariah George That Is Displayed In Statuary Hall In The United States Capitol With A Statue Of Civil Rights Icon Fannie Lou Hamer.

1924.title: Arielle Hudson; commend and congratulate upon being named a 2020 Rhodes Scholar.
1924.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Arielle Chansyae Tianna Hudson For Being Named A 2020 Rhodes Scholar And Becoming The University Of Mississippi's 27th Rhodes Scholar And Its First African-american Female Student To Receive The Prestigious International Scholarship Award.

1925.title: Joint Rules; amend to limit introduction of general bills requiring majority vote to sessions in even-numbered years.
1925.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend The Joint Rules Of The Mississippi Senate And House Of Representatives By Creating New Joint Rule 18a To Limit The Introduction Of General Bills Requiring A Majority Vote For Passage To Regular Legislative Sessions Occurring In Even-numbered Years.

1926.title: Mr. Albert M. Ray, Sr.; commend stellar career and service of.
1926.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Stellar Career And Community Service And Leadership Of Mr. Albert M. Ray, Sr., Provided To The City Of Laurel And The Entirety Of Jones County And The State Of Mississippi.

1927.title: Yazoo Backwater Pump Project; support the completion of.
1927.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Request The United States Army Corps Of Engineers, The Environmental Protection Agency, The Mississippi Levee Board And The Yazoo-mississippi Delta Levee Board To Take All Necessary Actions To Complete The Yazoo Backwater Pump Project As Soon As Possible.

1928.title: Puckett High School students; commend for placing second at the National 4-H Forestry Invitational.
1928.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Puckett High School Students, Ali Hammock, Caly Haskins, Payton Lemoine And Cole Tolbert As Well As Head Coach Patrick Lemoine For Placing Second At The National 4-h Forestry Invitational.

1929.title: Constitution; amend to provide that member of House or Senate for first time after January 1, 2021, not eligible to serve again in that office after serving three terms.
1929.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 34 And 35, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Elected As A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives Or The Mississippi Senate Is Eligible To Succeed Himself Or Herself In Office; To Provide That A Person Who Is Elected As A Member Of The House Or The Senate For The First Time On Or After January 1, 2021, Is Not Eligible To Serve Again In The House Or The Senate After Serving Three Terms In That Office.

1930.title: Joint Rules; adopt for 2020-2024 term.
1930.description: A Concurrent Resolution Adopting Joint Rules Of The Senate And The House Of Representatives For The 2020-2024 Term Of The Mississippi Legislature.

1931.title: Mr. William J. "Billy" McCoy; honor the life, service and legacy of upon his passing and express great sympathy to his family.
1931.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Honoring The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mr. William Joseph "billy" Mccoy Former Speaker Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives And Expressing Great Sympathy Upon His Passing.

1932.title: Congress; urge to call a convention of the states under Article V of the U.S. Constitution to propose amendments limited to balancing the federal budget.
1932.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying To The United States Congress To Call A Convention Of The States Under The Provisions Of Article V Of The Constitution Of The United States For The Purpose Of Proposing Amendments Limited To Balancing The Federal Budget; And For Related Purposes.

1933.title: "MS Initiative on HBCUs"; acknowledge importance of need to establish and encourage legislative support and funding.
1933.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging The Importance Of Creating The "mississippi Initiative On Historically Black Colleges And Universities (hbcus)" As A Means To Increase Opportunities For Hbcus To Participate In And Benefit From State Programs That Serve To Ensure That The State Of Mississippi Has The Highest Possible Proportion Of College Students Graduate From Hbcus In The Country And Encourage Legislative Support Of Such Initiative Through Appropriate Legislative Action And Funding.

1934.title: Constitution; amend to restore voting rights to qualified electors who have committed a felony once sentencing requirements are met.
1934.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Who Is Otherwise A Qualified Elector And Has Been Convicted Of A Felony Shall Have His Or Her Right To Vote Suspended Upon Conviction And Shall Not Have His Or Her Right To Vote Restored Until He Or She Has Satisfied All Of The Sentencing Requirements Of The Conviction; And Proposing The Repeal Of Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Provides That The Legislature May, By A Two-thirds Vote Of Both Houses, Of All Members Elected, Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of Crime.

1935.title: Daylight saving time; urge Congress to enact legislation to allow states to observe year-round.
1935.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Congress Of The United States To Enact Legislation Allowing Individual States To Establish Daylight Saving Time As The Standard Time In Their Respective States Throughout The Calendar Year.

1936.title: United States Constitution; urge congress to call convention of the states to amend regarding prayer in public schools.
1936.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Prayer In Public Schools And Urging And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1937.title: President Trump; urge to cancel any plans for a military parade and use monies to help the veterans.
1937.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging President Trump To Permanently Cancel His Military Parade And Use The Money To Help Our Military Veterans And Their Families.

1938.title: Ted Parker; commend upon being named the 2019 Swisher Sweets/Sunbelt Ag Expo Southeastern Farmer of the Year.
1938.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Ted Parker Upon Being Named The 2019 Swisher Sweets/sunbelt Ag Expo Southeastern Farmer Of The Year For Mississippi.

1939.title: Charvarius Ward; commend and congratulate for being a member of the Kansas City Chiefs, the Super Bowl LIV Champions.
1939.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mississippi's Native Son And The National Football League's Cornerback Extraordinaire, Charvarius Ward, Upon A Successful Season With The Kansas City Chiefs And Becoming A Super Bowl Liv Champion.

1940.title: Chris Jones; commend and congratulate for being a member of the Super Bowl LIV Champions Kansas City Chiefs.
1940.description: A Concurrent Resolution Saluting Mississippi's Native Son And The National Football League's Defensive End Extraordinaire, Chris Jones, Upon A Successful Season With The Kansas City Chiefs And Becoming A Super Bowl Liv Champion.

1941.title: Constitution; amend to abolish existing State Department of Education and transfer powers and duties to the Office of the Governor.
1941.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 203 And Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Abolish The Existing State Department Of Education And Transfer The Powers And Duties To The Office Of The Governor; To Provide That The Former State Department Of Education Shall Be Known As The Division Of Public Education In The Office Of The Governor; And For Related Purposes.

1942.title: Constitution; amend to restore voting rights to qualified electors who have committed certain felonies once sentencing requirements met.
1942.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Who Is Otherwise A Qualified Elector And Has Been Convicted Of Murder, Rape, Bribery, Theft, Arson, Obtaining Money Or Goods Under False Pretense, Perjury, Forgery, Embezzlement Or Bigamy Shall Have His Or Her Right To Vote Suspended Upon Conviction And Shall Have His Or Her Right To Vote Restored Once He Or She Has Satisfied All Of The Sentencing Requirements Of The Conviction; And Proposing The Repeal Of Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Provides That The Legislature May, By A Two-thirds Vote Of Both Houses, Of All Members Elected, Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of Crime.

1943.title: Constitution; amned to dissolve the Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning.
1943.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 213-a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Abolish The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Effective May 7, 2021; To Provide That The Governance Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Shall Be Vested In A Board Of Trustees For Each University Elected By The Alumni Associations And Duly Enrolled Members Of The Student Body Of Each Respective University; To Prescribe The Composition Of The Board And Terms Of Office Of Such Individuals Elected To Serve As Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

1945.title: Constitution; amend to reconstitute the Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning.
1945.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reconstitute The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

1946.title: Everest; commend upon becoming the state's first rural education and innovation hub to train computer coding professionals.
1946.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Everest, As Mississippi's First Rural Education And Innovation Hub And Its Contributions To The State's Workforce Development.

1947.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit local governments from imposing upon any real property an ad valorem tax rate of more than 200 mills.
1947.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Article 14, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Create A New Section To Provide That, Except For Drainage Purposes, No Local Government May Impose Upon Any Real Property In The State A Total Ad Valorem Tax Rate Of More Than 200 Mills For Any Fiscal Year Without The Consent Of The Property Owners To Which The Tax Would Apply; And For Related Purposes.

1948.title: Nineteenth amendment; celebrate ratification of.
1948.description: A Concurrent Resolution Celebrating March 22, 2020, As The 36th Anniversary Of The Ratification Of The Nineteenth Amendment In Mississippi, Celebrating August 26, 2020, As The 100th Anniversary Of The Nineteenth Amendment Being Added To The United States Constitution, And Reaffirming Mississippi's Commitment To Empowering And Uplifting The Voices Of Women Across This Great Magnolia State.

1949.title: Constitution; amend to require appointments to the IHL Board to be made by the Governor, Lieutenant Governor and Speaker of the House.
1949.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 213-a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Appointment Of Members To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning By The Governor, Lieutenant Governor And Speaker Of The House Of Representatives After January 1, 2020, For Vacancies Created By The Expiration Of Members' Terms Of Office; To Provide That The Governor, Lieutenant Governor And Speaker Of The House Of Representatives Shall Have One Appointment Each Made From Each Of The Mississippi Supreme Court Districts; To Prescribe The Process For Making Such Appointments Upon The Expirations Of Members' Terms Beginning With Appointments To Be Made In 2021; And For Related Purposes.

1950.title: Joint Rules; amend to create a procedure for issuance of ethnic disparity impact statements.
1950.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Create New Joint Rule No. 41 To Provide A Procedure For The Issuance Of A Racial And Ethnic Disparity Impact Statement For Every Bill, Concurrent Resolution And Amendment Which Proposes A Change In The Law That Creates A Public Offense.

1951.title: Constitution; amend to provide automatic restoration of suffrage for persons convicted of nonviolent crimes.
1951.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Automatic Restoration Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of A Nonviolent Crime, After A Period Of Five Years From The Completion Of Any Sentence, Probation And/or Payment Of Restitution; And For Related Purposes.

1952.title: Constitution; amend to restore voting rights to certain qualified electors once sentencing requirements are met.
1952.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Who Is Otherwise A Qualified Elector And Has Been Convicted Of Voter Fraud, Bribery, Theft, Arson, Obtaining Money Or Goods Under False Pretense, Perjury, Forgery, Embezzlement, Bigamy Or Any Crime Interpreted As Disenfranchising In Later Attorney General Opinions Except For Murder And Rape Shall Have His Or Her Right To Vote Suspended Upon Conviction And Shall Have His Or Her Right To Vote Restored Once He Or She Has Satisfied All Of The Sentencing Requirements Of The Conviction; And Proposing The Repeal Of Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Provides That The Legislature May, By A Two-thirds Vote Of Both Houses, Of All Members Elected, Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of Crime.

1953.title: Constitution; amend to provide certain rights to victims throughout the criminal and juvenile justice systems.
1953.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide Certain Rights To Victims Throughout The Criminal And Juvenile Justice Systems.

1954.title: Lieutenant Colonel Reuben Soliz; commend for display of courage under fire.
1954.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Leadership And Foresight Of Lieutenant Colonel Reuben Soliz, Commander Of The 379th Expeditionary Aeromedical Evacuation Squadron, For Exemplary And Meritorious Response To Adversity To Ensure The Safety Of Those Under His Command.

1955.title: Dr. Clyde Muse; commend laudable career and distinguished service of upon the occasion of his retirement.
1955.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Laudable Career And Distinguished Service Of Dr. Clyde Muse As President Of Hinds Community College And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement On June 30, 2020, After 42 Years Of Remarkable Service.

1956.title: Constitution; legislative alternative to Initiative No. 65 regarding medical marijuana.
1956.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Create New Article 16, Section 290 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Offered By The Mississippi Legislature As An Alternative To Initiative Measure No. 65, To Require The Legislature To Provide, By General Law, For The Establishment Of A Medical Marijuana Program For The Purpose Of Offering Treatment For Mississippi Patients Suffering Chronic, Debilitating Medical Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

1958.title: Madison County Sheriff Deputy Brad Sullivan; commend heroism of.
1958.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Inspirational Heroism Of Madison County Sheriff Deputy Brad Sullivan While In The Line Of Duty, And Extending Our Most Sincere Wishes For Continued Success During His Recovery And In All Of His Future Endeavors.

1959.title: Equal Rights Amendment to the U. S. Constitution; ratify.
1959.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Ratify The Equal Rights Amendment To The United States Constitution.

1960.title: State of Mississippi; declare as "Second Amendment Sanctuary" state.
1960.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Declare The State Of Mississippi As A "second Amendment Sanctuary" State.

1961.title: Constitution; signatures of electors from any congressional district cannot exceed a certain fractional portion of the total number required to qualify initiative for ballot.
1961.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 273, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That To Qualify An Initiative Petition For Placement Upon The Ballot, Signatures Of The Qualified Electors From Any Congressional District Shall Not Exceed A Certain Fractional Portion Of The Total Number Of Signatures Required.

1962.title: Breeland Speaks; commend and congratulate for being a member of the Kansas City Chiefs, the Super Bowl LIV Champions.
1962.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mississippi's Native Son And The National Football League's Defensive End Extraordinaire, Breeland Speaks, Upon A Successful Season With The Kansas City Chiefs And Becoming A Super Bowl Liv Champion.

1964.title: Constitution; amend to provide that there will be open primaries for the election of county offices, justice court judges and district attorneys.
1964.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 138, 171 And 174, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That There Will Be No Party Primaries For The Election Of County Offices, Justice Court Judges And District Attorneys, But Instead Will Be An Open Primary For All Candidates And A Runoff If Necessary.

1965.title: Constitution; remove the electoral vote requirement for the Governor.
1965.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 140 And Repealing Sections 141, 142 And 143 To Provide That The Person Receiving A Majority Of The Votes For The Office Of Governor And All Statewide Elected Officials At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held As Provided By General Law; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor And All Statewide Elected Officials Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1966.title: Chief Reynolds "Frank" Nichols; commend service and esteemed career upon his retirement.
1966.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Meritorious Law Enforcement Career Of Starkville Police Chief Reynolds "frank" Nichols Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1967.title: Honorable Judge Houston J. Patton; mourn loss and commend life and legacy of service upon his passing.
1967.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Distinguished Legacy Of Esteemed Public Service Of The Honorable Judge Houston J. Patton And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1968.title: "Second Chance Month"; designate the month of April 2020.
1968.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating April 2020, As "second Chance Month."

1969.title: Constitution; amend to revise the authority of IHL Board to choose university presidents.
1969.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 213-a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Establish A Policy To Govern The Process By Which Institutional Executive Officers Are Selected, Through The Use Of An Appointed Seven-member Search Committee, Established Solely For The Purpose Of Recommending Qualified Candidates In Accordance With Board Policy; To Provide That The Delegation Of Such Authority To A Search Committee Shall Not Be Construed To Limit The Power Of The Board To Have The Final Authority To Select The Institutional Executive Officers Of The Various State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Provide That The Board Shall Not Be Authorized To Appoint An Institutional Executive Officer Until The Search Committee Has Considered And Evaluated The Candidate; And For Related Purposes.

1970.title: Jobs for Mississippi Graduates; commend and congratulate students' success at JAG National Student Leadership Academy.
1970.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Gentry High School Students And Jobs For Mississippi Graduates' Participants, A'myah Robinson, Sylvester Washington, Jr., Colee M. Anthony And T'rossi Pernell, And Jackson School District Academic & Performing Arts Complex (apac) Program's, Zacchaeus Wallace, Upon Their Success At The Jobs For America's Graduates National Student Leadership Academy.

1971.title: Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College; commend for winning the NJCAA football championship.
1971.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College Bulldogs Football Team And Head Coach Jack Wright For Their Outstanding Season And For Winning The National Junior College Athletic Association Football Championship.

1972.title: Zeita Merchant; commend upon promotion to rank of Captain in United States Coast Guard.
1972.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Former Jackson, Mississippi, Resident And Lanier High School Alumnus, Zeita Merchant, Upon Being Promoted To The Rank Of Captain In The United States Coast Guard.

1973.title: Mr. Ken Spears; commend upon the occasion of his retirement.
1973.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mr. Ken Spears Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As Constable, Place 2, For Neshoba County, Mississippi.

1974.title: Serve Together: National Week of Post-Partisan Action; observe during week of February 17-21, 2020, in Mississippi.
1974.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Effort Of Legislative And Political Bipartisanship In The State Of Mississippi To Reestablish Political Cooperation Across Parties, And Encouraging The Observance Of "serve Together: National Week Of Post-partisan Action" During The Week Of February 17-21, 2020.

1975.title: Parkinson's Disease Awareness Month; recognize April 2020 as.
1975.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring The Month Of April 2020 As "parkinson's Disease Awareness Month."

1976.title: Saint Andrew's Episcopal School "Saints" Boys Basketball Team; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 3A State Championship.
1976.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The 2019-2020 Saint Andrew's Episcopal School "saints" Boys Basketball Team Upon Winning The 2020 Mhsaa Class 3a State Basketball Championship And The Teams Fourth Consecutive Class 3a State Basketball Championship.

1977.title: Essie B. and William E. Glenn Foundation; commend for great works in the community and declare June 22, 2020, as day of.
1977.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Essie B. And William Earl Glenn Foundation For Better Living On The Occasion Of Hosting Its First Community-focused Adverse Childhood Experiences Trauma Awareness Symposium In Jackson, Mississippi, And Declaring June 22, 2020, As Essie B. And William Earl Glenn Foundation Day.

1978.title: Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Boys Soccer Team; commend and congratulate on winning Class 6A State Championship.
1978.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2019-2020 Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Boys Soccer Team And Head Coach Jeff French And Coach Michael Archbold Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Boys Soccer State Championship.

1979.title: Huntington's Disease Awareness Month; declare and designatee month of May 2020 as in the State of Mississippi.
1979.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating And Declaring The Month Of May 2020 As "huntington's Disease Awareness Month" In The State Of Mississippi.

1980.title: Entergy Mississippi; recognize and commend employees of on providing 10 years of historically low cost electricity on occasion of its Celebrate 10 Event.
1980.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Employees Of Entergy Mississippi On Providing 10 Years Of Historically Low Cost Electricity To Residents And Businesses Of The State Of Mississippi Upon Its Celebrate 10 Event Commemorating This Achievement.

1981.title: Article V Convention; provide for selection and authority of commissioners.
1981.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Provide For The Selection And Authority Of Commissioners To Attend An Article V Convention Called For Proposing Amendments To The United States Constitution.

1982.title: Pine Grove High School Lady Panthers Basketball Team; commend on winning fourth consecutive Class 1A State Championship.
1982.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The 2019-2020 Pine Grove High School Lady Panthers Basketball Team Upon Winning The 2020 Mhsaa Class 1a State Basketball Championship And The Team's Fourth Consecutive Class 1a State Basketball Championship.

1983.title: Legislature; extend session, allow reconvening upon joint determination, and adjust deadlines to conform.
1983.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Extend The 2020 Regular Session Of The Legislature For A Period Of Thirty Days From The Final Day Of The One Hundred Twenty-five Day Session To June 9, 2020; To Authorize The House And Senate To Adjourn For More Than Three Days; To Provide That The House And Senate Shall Reconvene On April 1, 2020, Unless The Speaker And Lieutenant Governor Jointly Determine That It Is Not Necessary To Reconvene; To Authorize The Speaker And Lieutenant Governor To Reconvene The House And Senate Before Or After April 1, 2020; To Extend The 2020 Regular Session Of The Legislature For Another Period Of Thirty Days To July 9, 2020, If The House And Senate Have Not Adjourned Sine Die On Or Before June 9, 2020; To Provide That If The Session Is Extended For A Second Period Of Thirty Days, The House And Senate Shall Reconvene On June 17, 2020, Unless The Speaker And Lieutenant Governor Jointly Determine That It Is Not Necessary To Reconvene; To Authorize The Speaker And Lieutenant Governor To Reconvene The House And Senate Before Or After June 17, 2020; To Amend Joint Rule 40 To Provide That When The Speaker And The Lieutenant Governor Have Jointly Set A Date And Time To Reconvene The Legislature As Provided In This Resolution, The Legislative Deadlines Shall Be Adjusted To Later Dates In Seven-day Periods Which Shall Be Counted In A Manner To Ensure That Each Of The Deadlines Occurs On The Same Day Of The Week As The Original Date For The Deadline; And For Related Purposes.

1984.title: Mississippi Symphony Orchestra; commend on the occasion of its 75th Diamond Anniversary.
1984.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Mississippi Symphony Orchestra On The Occasion Of Its 75th Diamond Anniversary Season And For The Impressive And Inspiring Legacy Of Musical Contributions That It Has Provided To The People Of The State Of Mississippi.

1985.title: Ripley High School Girls basketball team; commend for winning MHSAA Class 4A State Basketball Championship.
1985.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Ripley High School Lady Tigers Basketball Team Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a State Basketball Championship.

1986.title: Dr. Edwin "Ed" J. Deuschle; commend upon formal receipt of meritorious service medals for heroism displayed during Vietnam War.
1986.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Distinguished Service Rendered To This State And Nation By Vietnam War Veteran, Dr. Edwin "ed" J. Deuschle, Upon The Official Receipt Of Meritorious Service Medals For His Display Of Heroism In The Face Of Adversity In Commemoration Of The 50th Anniversary Of The Vietnam Battle That Forever Altered His Life On May 5, 1970.

1987.title: Legislature; extend session, allow reconvening and suspend deadlines for certain bills.
1987.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Extend The 2020 Regular Session Of The Legislature For Successive Periods Of 30 Days From The Ending Date Of The Previous Extension Of The Session; To Provide That, Upon Certain Conditions, The House And Senate Shall Reconvene At Noon On Monday, October 5, 2020, Unless The Speaker Of The House And The Lieutenant Governor Jointly Determine That It Is Not Necessary To Reconvene; To Provide That, Upon Certain Conditions, The Speaker And The Lieutenant Governor May Jointly Determine That It Is Necessary For The House And Senate To Reconvene Before October 5, 2020, And The House And Senate Shall Reconvene On The Date And Time Jointly Declared By The Speaker And The Lieutenant Governor; To Provide That The House And Senate Shall Not Convene For More Than A Total Of Six Days During The Successive Periods Of Extensions Authorized By This Resolution; To Provide That The 2020 Regular Session Of The Legislature Shall Stand Adjourned Sine Die At Midnight On October 10, 2020, Unless An Earlier Date Is Necessary To Comply With The Six-day Limitation Or Unless An Earlier Date Is Set By Concurrent Resolution; To Provide That The Adjusted Timetable For Processing Legislation Issued By The Speaker And The Lieutenant Governor Under The Authority Of House Concurrent Resolution No. 65, 2020 Regular Session, Is Amended By Deleting The Date Of Sine Die On The 188th Day; To Suspend The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of Any Bill, And For The Purpose Of Permitting The Further Consideration And Passage Of Any Bill, Which Is Related To Any Action, Activity, Authorization Or Expenditure To Address Or Otherwise Due To The Public Health Emergency With Respect To Covid-19, And Which Is Authorized To Be Drafted, Introduced Or Considered Further By Either The House Rules Committee Or The Senate Rules Committee; And For Related Purposes.

1988.title: Walter Payton; commend and celebrate his outstanding athletic career and his induction into the NFL Hall of Fame.
1988.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Celebrating The Outstanding College And Nfl Athletic Career Of Walter Payton And Recognizing Him As One Of Jackson State University's Legendary Football Players Who Have Been Inducted Into The National Football League's Hall Of Fame.

1989.title: Robert Brazile; commend for NFL career and induction into 2018 class of NFL Hall of Fame.
1989.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Former National Football League Player Robert Brazile For His Monumental Football Career And For His Impressive 2018 Induction Into The National Football League Hall Of Fame.

1990.title: Class of 2020; commend and congratulate MS high school seniors upon graduation.
1990.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The State Of Mississippi's High Schools' Graduating Senior Classes Of 2020 Upon Their Academic Successes And Expressing The Greatest Hope For Success In Their Future Collegiate, Career, Athletic Or Military Endeavors.

1991.title: Rusty Berryhill; commend upon being named the 2019-2020 chairman of the MS Manufacturers Association Board of Directors.
1991.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Rusty Berryhill, The President Of Kevin Charles Fine Upholstery In New Albany, Mississippi, Upon Being Named The 2019-2020 Chairman Of The Mississippi Manufacturers Association (mma) Board Of Directors.

1992.title: Pastor Todd Tilghman; commend for winning The Voice.
1992.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Outstanding Musical Talent Of Pastor Todd Tilghman And Congratulating Him Upon Winning The 18th Season Of Nbc's The Voice.

1993.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Law enforcement; regulate with penalties for misconduct.
1993.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Require Each Law Enforcement Officer In This State To Wear Body Cameras At All Times While On Duty As A Law Enforcement Officer; To Require Each Law Enforcement Vehicle To Have Cameras For The Purposes Of Recording All Interactions Of Law Enforcement With Non-law Enforcement; To Provide Penalties For Any Law Enforcement Agency That Fails To Provide Such Body Or Vehicle Cameras; To Require That Such Body Or Vehicle Cameras Remain On And Operational During All Times An Officer Is On Duty As A Law Enforcement Officer; To Prohibit Interruption Of Video Footage Of Body And Vehicle Cameras; To Provide Penalties For The Officer And The Law Enforcement Agency For Such Violations; To Create A Rebuttable Presumption Of The Crime Of Murder, Manslaughter Or Aggravated Assault By Law Enforcement When A Person Is Killed By Law Enforcement, Dies As A Result Of Actions Of Law Enforcement Or Is Severely Injured As A Result Of Actions By Law Enforcement; To Create Enhanced Penalties For Such Actions If Such Actions Are Motivated By Race; To Describe How Video From The Cameras Must Be Retained By Law Enforcement Agencies; To Authorize Who May Obtain A Copy Of A Recording; To Provide Remedies For Violations Of This Act; To Require All Law Enforcement Agencies To Provide Racial-bias Training; To Require Each Law Enforcement Agency To Have An Online Law Enforcement Misconduct Registry; To Require Such Registry To Be Free, Public And Easily Accessible To Any Person; To Require The Registry To List All Complaints Or Acts Of Misconduct In An Itemized Fashion Listing With The Name Of Each Officer And The Complaints And Acts Attached; To Amend Sections 99-19-301, 99-19-303, 99-19-305 And 99-19-307, To Clarify That Crimes Committed By Law Enforcement Against Any Person Based On Race, Color, Ancestry, Ethnicity, Religion, National Origin, Gender, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity Or Disability; And For Related Purposes."

1994.title: Mr. A.C. McKenzie, Sr.; commend service as a World War II veteran and purple heart recipient.
1994.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Distinguished And Honorable Service Of World War Ii Veteran And Purple Heart Recipient Mr. A.c. Mckenzie, Sr., And Thanking Him For His Bravery And Service To The United States.

1995.title: Polly Matthews Gordon; commend life and legacy upon passing of.
1995.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Polly Matthews Gordon.

1996.title: Mrs. Emma Sanders; commend life and legacy upon her passing.
1996.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mrs. Emma Sanders And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1997.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; State Flag; revise with a Commission and require words "In God We Trust."
1997.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Establish A Commission To Redesign The Mississippi State Flag; To Prescribe The Membership Of The Commission And To Provide For Its Organization And Meetings; To Provide That The Design For The Mississippi State Flag Recommended By The Commission Shall Not Include The Design Of The Confederate Battle Flag But Shall Include The Words "in God We Trust"; To Provide That The Commission Shall Make Its Recommendation For A Design For The New Mississippi State Flag By September 14, 2020; To Provide That The Design For The New Mississippi State Flag Recommended By The Commission Shall Be Placed On The Ballot In A Special Election To Be Held On November 3, 2020; To Provide That If A Majority Of The Qualified Electors Vote For The New Design, Then The Legislature Shall Enact Into Law The New Design As The Official Mississippi State Flag; To Provide That If A Majority Of The Qualified Electors Vote Against The New Design, Then The Commission To Redesign The Mississippi State Flag Shall Reconvene To Recommend A New Design For The Mississippi State Flag To Be Presented To The Legislature During The 2021 Regular Session; To Require That The Special Election Be Administered By Means Of Ballots Containing A Color Picture Or Drawing Of The Design For The Mississippi State Flag; To Require The Secretary Of State To Provide Those Ballots To The Election Commissioners Of Each County; To Amend Sections 23-15-351 And 23-15-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; To Repeal Section 3-3-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides The Design For The Official Flag Of The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes."

1998.title: Suspend deadline for Introduction; 7% grocery sales tax and statewide testing program; provide exemptions from until state of emergency relating to COVID-19 no longer exists.
1998.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Require The State Board Of Education To Immediately Cease The Administration Of All Assessments Administered Under The Statewide Testing Program, Which Are Used To Determine The Accountability Ratings For School Districts And Individual Schools Within Local School Districts For The 2019-2020 School Year As The Result Of The Governor's Declaration Of An Extreme State Of Emergency In Response To A National Health Crisis Resulting From The Rapid Spread Of Covid-19; To Require The State Board Of Education To Hold Harmless School Districts From Assignment Of District And School Level Accountability Ratings For The 2019-2020 School Year; To Bring Forward Sections 37-16-1, 37-16-4, 37-16-5, 37-16-7 And 37-16-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Statewide Testing Program, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Sections 37-16-3, 37-16-17, 37-17-6, 37-3-49, 37-15-38 And 37-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Retail Sales Of Food For Human Consumption Not Purchased With Food Stamps But Which Would Be Exempt From Sales Tax If Purchased With Food Stamps; To Provide That Such Exemption Of Retail Sales Of Food For Human Consumption From Sales Taxation Shall Only Be Applicable Until Such Time That The Governor Declares The Extreme State Of Emergency Created By The Spread Of Covid-19 No Longer Exists In The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes."

1999.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Legislative authority in response to COVID-19; authorize monies for agencies to use in response to COVID-19.
1999.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security To Provide Paid Leave To Any Person Who Is Unable To Work Because The Person Has Been Confirmed With Covid-19, The Person's Employer Has Suspended Or Discontinued Business Due To Covid-19, The Person's Employer Has Reduced His Or Her Work Hours In Response To Covid-19 Or The Person Is Unable To Work Due To Lack Of Child Care As A Result Of School And Child Care Closings Or Suspension And Such Person Is Not Paid For The Loss Of Work Hours, As Applicable; To Authorize The Legislature To Appropriate Twenty Million Dollars To Provide Grants To Hospitals And County Health Departments For The Provision Of Free Testing And Treatment To Persons Exposed To Covid-19; To Require The Department Of Medicaid To Seek All Federal Waivers That Would Allow Uninsured Mississippians To Have Covid-19 Testing And Treatment; To Require The Department Of Human Services To Continue To Provide Reimbursement Payment To Child Care Operators During The Entire Time That The Governor Has Declared A State Of Emergency In Response To The Covid-19 Crises; And For Related Purposes."

2000.title: Paid leave for all employees affected by COVID-19; pledge to provide funding to MDES for purpose of providing.
2000.description: A Concurrent Resolution Pledging To Provide Funding To The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security For The Purpose Of Authorizing Paid Leave To Any Person Who Is Unable To Work Because The Person Has Been Confirmed With Covid-19, The Person's Employer Has Suspended Or Discontinued Business Due To Covid-19 Or The Person's Employer Has Reduced His Or Her Work Hours In Response To Covid-19 And Such Person Is Not Paid For The Loss Of Work Hours And Pay Related To The Discontinuation, Reduction Or Closure, As Applicable.

2001.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; MDES; require to provide paid leave to any person who is unable or not allowed to work because of COVID-19.
2001.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security To Provide Paid Leave To Any Person Who Is Unable To Work Because The Person Has Been Confirmed With Covid-19, The Person's Employer Has Suspended Or Discontinued Business Due To Covid-19 Or The Person's Employer Has Reduced His Or Her Work Hours In Response To Covid-19 And Such Person Is Not Paid For The Loss Of Work Hours"; And For Related Purposes."

2002.title: Suspend deadline for introduction; Statewide testing program; require SBE to cease administration of for the 2019-2020 school year.
2002.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Require The State Board Of Education To Immediately Cease The Administration Of All Assessments Administered Under The Statewide Testing Program, Which Are Used To Determine The Accountability Ratings For School Districts And Individual Schools Within Local School Districts For The 2019-2020 School Year As The Result Of The Governor's Declaration Of An Extreme State Of Emergency In Response To A National Health Crisis Resulting From The Rapid Spread Of Covid-19; To Require The State Board Of Education To Hold Harmless School Districts From Assignment Of District And School Level Accountability Ratings For The 2019-2020 School Year; To Bring Forward Sections 37-16-1, 37-16-4, 37-16-5, 37-16-7, 37-16-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Statewide Testing Program, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Sections 37-16-3, 37-16-17, 37-17-6, 37-3-49, 37-15-38 And 37-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes."

2003.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction and further consideration; appropriation bills for school recognition program and Department of Marine Resources for fiscal year 2021.
2003.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of, And For The Purpose Of Permitting The Further Consideration And Passage Of, Any Appropriation Bill Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Education For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funding For The School Recognition Program For Fiscal Year 2021, And Any Appropriation Bill Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Marine Resources For Fiscal Year 2021; And For Related Purposes.

2004.title: Legislature; amend HCR 69 to allow reconvening for considering vetoed bills and to delete alternate sine die date.
2004.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend House Concurrent Resolution No. 69, 2020 Regular Session, To Delete The Alternate Date For Sine Die Adjournment Of The 2020 Regular Session Of The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2005.title: Teachers' salaries; provide for increase.
2005.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Minimum Teacher Salary Scale By Increasing The Minimum Salary; To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Minimum Annual Salary For Teacher Assistants; And For Related Purposes.

2006.title: Wildlife Trafficking Prevention Act; enact.
2006.description: An Act To Enact The "wildlife Trafficking Prevention Act"; To Prohibit The Purchase, Sell Or Exchange Of Certain Wildlife Species; To Provide A Civil Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2007.title: Wildlife; require the Department of Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks to identify existing and needed wildlife corridors.
2007.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, In Conjunction With The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, To Identify Existing And Needed Wildlife Corridors; To File A Report And Recommendations; And For Related Purposes.

2008.title: Health care CON review; party requesting or appealing a hearing on application is responsible for costs and attorney fees.
2008.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-197, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Party Requesting A Hearing On An Application For A Health Care Certificate Of Need Who Does Not Prevail At The Hearing Shall Pay Costs And Attorney Fees, And To Apply The Same Requirement To Any Party Who Appeals An Order Of The Hearing Officer To The Proper Court And Loses On Appeal; And For Related Purposes.

2009.title: State Health Insurance Plan; provide benefits to surviving spouse/dependent of law enforcement officer killed in the line of duty.
2009.description: An Act To Provide Benefits Under The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan To The Surviving Spouse Or A Surviving Dependent Of Any Law Enforcement Officer Who Is Killed In The Line Of Duty Or Dies From Injuries Suffered In The Line Of Duty; To Provide That Such Coverage Shall Be The Same Plan Of Benefits As Provided To An Employee Under The Plan; To Amend Section 25-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Previous Section; And For Related Purposes.

2010.title: Depositories; revise bid process for selection by counties and municipalities.
2010.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-105-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide County Boards Of Supervisors The Discretion To Determine The Interval Of Time For Providing Notice To Financial Institutions Of The Opening Of The Bidding Process For Serving As Depositories Of County Funds; To Clarify That The Selection Of Depositories Is To Be Based Upon All Relevant Factors; And For Related Purposes.

2011.title: Justice court; revise jurisdictional amount.
2011.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Jurisdictional Amount For Justice Court; And For Related Purposes.

2012.title: Towing; limit charges.
2012.description: An Act To Amend Section 85-7-251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Towing And Storage Charges For Vehicles Towed At The Direction Of A Law Enforcement Officer To Those Amounts Charged To Customers Generally; And For Related Purposes.

2013.title: Sex offenders; future contact with victim prohibited (Carly's Law).
2013.description: An Act To Enact "carly's Law; To Create New Section 45-33-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Future Contact With The Crime Victim By A Convicted Sex Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2014.title: Statute of limitations; except sexual battery without regard to victim's age.
2014.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Two-year Statute Of Limitations On Crimes Will Not Run Against The Crime Of Sexual Battery; And For Related Purposes.

2015.title: Arrest; require probable cause hearing for legislators.
2015.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-3-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Probable Cause Hearing Before An Arrest Warrant May Be Issued For A Legislator; To Provide Certain Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2016.title: Conviction; clarify subsequent for certain crimes and post-conviction relief.
2016.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Meaning Of Second Or Subsequent Offense For Certain Drug Convictions; To Amend Sections 99-39-5 And 99-39-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Dismissal Or Denial Of Post-conviction Relief Shall Not Be A Bar To A Second Or Successive Application Or Motion For Relief When There Has Been An Intervening Adoption Or Enactment Of State Law That Would Have Actually Affected The Outcome Of The Conviction Or Sentence; And For Related Purposes.

2017.title: Tenth Circuit Court District; create subdistrict and additional judge.
2017.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-7-31 And 9-7-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Subdistricts Within The Tenth Circuit Court District And To Revise The Number Of Circuit Court Judges In That District; To Provide For Precinct Boundaries; To Provide For Candidacy For Election For Judgeships Before The Inception Of The New Judgeship; And For Related Purposes.

2018.title: Schools; require carbon monoxide detectors in all.
2018.description: An Act To Require Carbon Monoxide Detectors In All Public And Nonpublic Schools In Mississippi; To Authorize And Direct The State Fire Marshal To Provide Requirements For Testing And Inspecting Carbon Monoxide Detection And Warning Equipment Installed In Public Or Nonpublic School Buildings; And For Related Purposes.

2019.title: Payroll date for school district employees; authorize semimonthly payroll in discretion of local school board.
2019.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-151-103 And 37-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts To Process A Semimonthly Or A Monthly Payroll For Licensed And Nonlicensed Employees, In The Discretion Of The Local School Board; And For Related Purposes.

2020.title: Assistant teachers; increase salaries for.
2020.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Salaries For Assistant Teachers; And For Related Purposes.

2021.title: Local school board members; prescribe salary scale based upon school district student enrollment.
2021.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe The Salary For Local School Board Members Based On School District Student Enrollment; And For Related Purposes.

2022.title: Civics Test; require passing score for high school graduates and high school equivalency diploma applicants.
2022.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require High School Graduates To Pass At Least 60% Of The Civics Portion Of The Naturalization Test Used By The Immigration Services; To Amend Section 37-35-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require High School Equivalency Diploma Applicants To Pass At Least 60% Of The Civics Portion Of The Naturalization Test Used By The Immigration Services; And For Related Purposes.

2024.title: Absentee ballot; require placement in unmarked envelope to ensure ballot secrecy.
2024.description: An Act To Amend Sections 23-15-631, 23-15-635, 23-15-639, 23-15-719 And 23-15-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Absentee Ballots Be Placed In An Unmarked Envelope Inside The Envelope Upon Which The Required Affidavits Are Printed In Order To Ensure Secrecy Of The Ballot; To Revise The Procedures For Handling Absentee Ballots To Conform To This Requirement; And For Related Purposes.

2025.title: Average daily attendance for MAEP purposes; shall include any student sick day.
2025.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Average Daily Attendance For Adequate Education Funding Purposes Shall Include Any Day That A Student Is Absent Due To Illness Or Injury; And For Related Purposes.

2026.title: Kindergarten-age children; require compulsory school attendance for all.
2026.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-13-91 And 37-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Of The Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law Are Fully Applicable To Kindergarten-age Children; To Require Such Kindergarten-age Children To Attend Licensed Public, Parochial, Nonpublic Or Homeschool Kindergarten Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2027.title: Assistant teachers; require school districts to notify of nonreemployment.
2027.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Give Assistant Teachers Notification Of Nonreemployment No Later Than 10 Days After The Adoption Of The District's Annual Budget By The Board For The Forthcoming Academic School Year; And For Related Purposes.

2028.title: Teachers' salary; implement a four-year phase in to increase to the southeastern average.
2028.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Increase Of The Starting Base Teacher Salary To $40,000.00 Over A Four-year Period; To Provide That Beginning In The 2024-2025 School Year, Teacher Salaries Be Equal To The Southeastern Regional Average; And For Related Purposes.

2029.title: Department of Education; develop system for schools to report data required by federal law.
2029.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Develop A Central Reporting System To Be Used By School Districts For The Mandatory Reporting To The Department Of All Data Required By Federal Law To Be Reported To The United States Department Of Education Office For Civil Rights; To Require The State Department Of Education And School Districts And Charter Schools To Publish Said Information On Their Respective Websites; And For Related Purposes.

2030.title: IHL; must allocate funding for nonresident students to student financial aid programs.
2030.description: An Act To Provide That The Funding Allocation Model Employed By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Must Weight Nonresident Completed Credit Hours Based On The Percentage Of Nonresident Enrollment At Each Institution; To Establish Appropriate Weighting For Nonresident Credit Hour Completion; To Provide That The Difference In Funds Between The Board's 2013 Performance Allocation Model And The Funding Allocation Model With Appropriate Weighting Shall Be Set Aside To Fund Grant Awards Under The Higher Education Legislative Plan Grant Program; To Amend Sections 37-101-15 And 37-106-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2031.title: Appropriation FY2021; Church of God in Christ historical markers in Holmes County, Mississippi.
2031.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History, For The Purpose Of Providing Appropriate Historical Markers In Holmes County Designating The Birthplace Of The Church Of God In Christ.

2032.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to assist Delta Blues Museum's installation of permanent exhibits.
2032.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Acquisition, Storage And Relocation Of Artifacts And The Design, Fabrication And Installation Of Permanent Exhibits, Including The Development Of All Associated Films And Interactive Components, For The Delta Blues Museum In Clarksdale, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2033.title: Bonds; authorize to assist Marks, MS, in construction of building for emergency shelter, community center and city hall.
2033.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Marks, Mississippi, In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Building To House An Emergency Shelter, A Community Center And The Marks City Hall; And For Related Purposes.

2034.title: 2018 Transportation and Infrastructure Improvements Fund; specify additional capital projects in Crenshaw and Marks, Mississippi.
2034.description: An Act To Amend Section 12 Of Senate Bill No. 2002, Chapter 3, Laws Of The First Extraordinary Session Of 2018, To Require The State Treasurer To Transfer A Certain Amount Of Funds From The Budget Contingency Fund To The 2018 Transportation And Infrastructure Improvements Fund For Certain Capital Improvement Projects In The Town Of Crenshaw And The Town Of Marks, Mississippi; To Amend Section 27-104-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Capital Improvement Projects In The Town Of Crenshaw And The Town Of Marks, Mississippi, For Which Money May Be Disbursed; And For Related Purposes.

2035.title: Alcoholic beverages; reduce privilege tax for package retailer's permits for locations in cities with a population of 5,000 or less.
2035.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Privilege License Tax For Package Retailer's Permit Issued For Package Stores Located In Municipalities With A Population Of 5,000 Or Less According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census; And For Related Purposes.

2036.title: Sales taxation; exempt sales to certain community action agencies exempted from federal income taxation.
2036.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To Certain Community Action Organizations That Are Exempt From Federal Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

2037.title: Sales tax; exempt sales to Head Start programs.
2037.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Service To Head Start Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of to assist Marks, MS, in the construction of a building to house a community center and its city hall.
2038.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Marks, Mississippi, In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Building To House A Community Center And The Marks City Hall; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Counties and municipalities; prohibit surcharge on certain payments by credit or debit cards.
2039.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-25-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Counties And Municipalities From Imposing A Surcharge Or Transaction Fee On Certain Payments By Credit Card, Charge Card, Debit Card Or Other Form Of Electronic Payment In Lieu Of Payment By Cash, Check Or Similar Means; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: Official Mississippi state song; authorize two state songs.
2040.description: An Act Authorizing Mississippi To Have Two Official State Songs Consisting Of The Present Official State Song "go, Mississippi" And "my Home Mississippi"; And For Related Purposes.

2041.title: Law enforcement training expenses; revise time for reimbursement of formerly employing entity.
2041.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time During Which A Governmental Entity Must Reimburse The Formerly Employing Governmental Entity For The Costs Incurred By That Entity For The Officer's Law Enforcement Training; And For Related Purposes.

2042.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize issuance for Mississippi State Parks.
2042.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of Mississippi State Parks; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2043.title: Electric and hybrid motor vehicle taxes; exclude vehicles incapable of exceeding 35 miles per hour.
2043.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Vehicles Incapable Of Exceeding The Speed Of 35 Miles Per Hour From The Definition Of "electric Vehicle" For Purposes Of The Electric Vehicle Tax, And To Refund Taxes Collected On Such Vehicles; To Amend Section 27-19-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Vehicles Incapable Of Exceeding The Speed Of 35 Miles Per Hour From The Definition Of "hybrid Vehicle" For Purposes Of The Hybrid Vehicle Tax, And To Refund Taxes Collected On Such Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: Legislature; reduce size of beginning with the 2023 statewide general election.
2044.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Number Of Representatives In The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Be Reduced To 99 Representatives Beginning With The 2023 Statewide General Election; To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Number Of Senators In The Mississippi Senate Shall Be Reduced To 42 Senators Beginning With The 2023 Statewide General Election; And For Related Purposes.

2045.title: Mississippi Daylight Protection Act; create.
2045.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Daylight Protection Act"; To Provide Legislative Intent That Daylight Saving Time Shall Be The Year-round Standard Time Of The Entire State Of Mississippi And All Of Its Political Subdivisions Under Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2046.title: State agencies; prohibit use of monies budgeted for vacant positions to fund salary increase for filled positions.
2046.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit State Agencies From Transferring Or Using Monies Budgeted For Any Vacant Position To Fund An Increase In Salaries, Wages And Fringe Benefits For Any Filled Position; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: Alteration or renaming of historical monuments, memorials and streets; prohibit and provide sanctions.
2047.description: An Act To Amend Section 55-15-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Provisions Of The Statutory Prohibition Against The Alteration Of Historical Monuments And Memorials Located On Public Property; To Prohibit The Renaming Or Rededication Of Certain Statutes, Monuments, Schools, Streets, Parks Or Similar Structures Named In Honor Of Certain Military Units, Figures Or Events; To Provide Criminal Sanctions For Violation Of This Statute; To Provide That This Section Shall Be Known As The "mississippi Heritage Protection Act Of 2020"; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Bonds; authorize the Department of Audit to be reimbursed certain costs from the proceeds of bond issues.
2048.description: An Act To Provide That The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By Any Act Of The Legislature Passed After July 1, 2020, May Be Used To Reimburse Reasonable Actual And Necessary Costs Incurred By The Department Of Audit In Providing Services Related To A Project For Which Funding Is Provided From The Use Of Proceeds Of Such Bonds; To Limit The Amount That May Be Reimbursed; And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: State flag; require governmental entities, public colleges, universities and school districts to display or be subject to penalty.
2049.description: An Act To Amend Sections 3-3-15 And 37-13-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Governmental Entities That Receive State Funds And Public Colleges And Universities To Display The Official State Flag On Monday Through Friday Of Each Week On Or At Each Building In Which An Office Of The Governmental Entity Is Located And On Each Campus Of Each Public College Or University Or School District; To Require That If A Governmental Entity Or A Public College Or University Or School District Is Not Displaying The Official State Flag As Required By This Section, The Governor Shall Notify The Governmental Entity Or The Public College Or University Or School District Of The Noncompliance, And The State Fiscal Officer Shall Withhold All State Funding For Such Public Entity Until Such Time As It Is In Compliance With The Requirements Of This Section; To Provide That Local Governmental Entities Or Homeowners Associations Shall Not Prohibit The Display Of The State Flag On Private Property Or Public Property Which Is Leased To A Private Entity; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: Mid-year budget reductions; exempt MAEP funds.
2050.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Mississippi Adequate Education Program From Mid-year Budget Reductions; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: Mississippi Minimum Wage Act; establish.
2051.description: An Act To Enact A Minimum Wage Law For The State Of Mississippi, With Annual Incremental Increases Over A Three-year Period; To Define Employers And Employees Subject To The Minimum Wage Law; To Empower The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Enforce And Administer The Provisions Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Provide Criminal Penalties And A Civil Cause Of Action Against Employers For Violations Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Amend Section 17-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Municipal And County Governing Authorities, In Their Discretion, To Mandate A Wage That Is More Than The State Minimum Wage; To Amend Section 25-3-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists (CRNA); no physician supervision required after two years of practice in good standing.
