2980.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2021, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2021.

2981.title: Appropriation; Development Authority, Mississippi.
2981.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Development Authority For Fiscal Year 2021.

2982.title: Appropriation; IHL - General support.
2982.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities For Fiscal Year 2021.

2983.title: Appropriations; additional appropriations for Veterans Affairs Board for FY20.
2983.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Veterans Affairs Board For Fiscal Year 2020; And For Related Purposes.

2984.title: Appropriations; additional appropriations for various state agencies for FY20.
2984.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Capital Expense Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Corrections, Office Of Attorney General, And The Department Of Human Services For Fiscal Year 2020 And Fiscal Year 2021; And For Related Purposes.

2985.title: Grenada County; establish Greater Grenada Partnership as economic and industrial development authority.
2985.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Grenada County, Mississippi, To Establish An Economic And Industrial Development Authority To Be Known As The Greater Grenada Partnership; To Provide For The Appointment Of Trustees Of The Partnership; To Specify The Powers And Duties Of The Partnership; To Allow The Board Of Supervisors To Authorize The Partnership To Provide Certain Economic And/or Industrial Development For The County And The Municipalities Located Therein; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Dissolve The Grenada County Economic Development District; And For Related Purposes.

2986.title: Marshall County; authorize to contribute matching funds to ICS Head Start and Northeast Mississippi Community Services, Inc.
2986.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Expend Annually, From County Funds, Local Matching Funds To Ics Head Start, A Federal Nonprofit Program, And Northeast Mississippi Community Services, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2987.title: Coahoma County; authorize board of supervisors to contribute to But God Ministries.
2987.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Contribute Up To $15,000.00 Annually To But God Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

2988.title: Marshall County; authorize to contribute to a 501(c)(3) qualified charitable organizations to support food pantries.
2988.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually, In An Aggregate Amount Not To Exceed $7,500.00, To Certain Qualified Charitable Organizations With Valid And Current 501(c)(3) Designations, For The Support Of Food Pantries Operated By The Organizations; And For Related Purposes.

2989.title: Town of Belmont; authorize to expand and operate natural gas distribution system to serve certain areas of Itawamba County.
2989.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Belmont, Mississippi, To Expand And Operate Its Natural Gas Distribution System Within A Certain Area Outside The Corporate Limits In Order To Provide Gas Service To Underserved Areas Of Itawamba County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2990.title: City of Olive Branch; authorize 1% tax on hotels and motels and issuance of bonds for tourism and parks and recreation.
2990.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Olive Branch, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals For The Purposes Of Tourism And Parks And Recreation; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; For The Purposes Of Tourism And Parks And Recreation, To Authorize The City To Issue General Obligation Bonds Or Incur Other Indebtedness In An Aggregate Principal Amount Not In Excess Of An Amount For Which Debt Service Is Capable Of Being Funded By The Proceeds Of The Special Sales Tax Levied Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2991.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Town of Ashland with improvements to Town Maintenance Shop Building and Facility.
2991.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Ashland, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Making Improvements To Its Town Maintenance Shop Building And Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2992.title: Bonds; authorize to assist Pontotoc County with parking lot paving and rear access road for extension service facility.
2992.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Pontotoc County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Paving The Parking Lot And Creating A Rear Access Road For The Pontotoc County Extension Service Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2993.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Pontotoc County in paying costs of renovation of W.A. Grist Building.
2993.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Pontotoc County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Renovation Of The W.a. Grist Building, To Be Used For Employee Seminars, Training And Access To Free Legal Clinics; And For Related Purposes.

2994.title: Fueling Station Tax Credit Act; create.
2994.description: An Act To Authorize A Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Place A Qualified Alternative-fuel Fueling Station In Service During Calendar Year 2020 Or 2021; To Define Terms; To Allow The Credit To Be Applied Against Income Taxes, Premium And Related Retaliatory Taxes, Or Franchise Taxes; To Provide That The Credit Shall Be Equal To 75% Of The Cost Of Any Qualified Alternative-fuel Fueling Station Placed In Service During Calendar Year 2020 Or 2021; To Provide That Taxpayers Shall Submit Applications For The Credit To The Department Of Revenue; To Impose An Aggregate Cap For The Credits Of $12.5 Million Annually, For A Cumulative Cap Of $25 Million Over The Two-year Period In Which Applications For The Credit May Be Made; To Provide That The Credits Shall Be Nonrefundable And Nontransferable; To Allow Unused Credits To Be Carried Forward For Up To Five Years; To Require Any Taxpayer Claiming This Credit To Submit An Annual Report To The Department Of Environmental Quality; To Allow The Department Of Revenue To Adopt And Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Implement The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2995.title: Income tax; provide credit for caregivers.
2995.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit To Taxpayers For Certain Expenses Incurred In Providing Care For A Spouse, Parent, Stepparent Or Other Relative Who Is 18 Years Of Age Or Older And Who Has Been Certified By A Licensed Health Care Provider As Being An Individual Requiring Assistance With At Least One Activity Of Daily Living; And For Related Purposes.

2996.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Jasper County in paying costs of upgrade to Beaver Meadow Community VFD Station.
2996.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Jasper County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With An Upgrade To The Beaver Meadow Community Volunteer Fire Department Station To House A New Fire Engine; And For Related Purposes.

2997.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Town of Heidelberg in paying costs of street repairs.
2997.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Heidelberg, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Leveling, Asphalt And Shoulder Work On Certain Municipal Streets; And For Related Purposes.

2998.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Bay Springs in paying costs of street repairs.
2998.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Bay Springs, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Repair Of City Streets; And For Related Purposes.

2999.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Town of Louin in paying costs of water line replacement.
2999.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Louin, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Replacement Of A Water Line; And For Related Purposes.

3000.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Laurel in paying costs of street repairs.
3000.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Laurel, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Repairs To An Intersection And Certain City Streets; And For Related Purposes.

3001.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of West Point in improvements and repairs to Marshall Park.
3001.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of West Point, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Improvements And Repairs To Marshall Park; And For Related Purposes.

3002.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of West Point in the remodeling, renovation and improvement of Northside School.
3002.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of West Point, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Remodeling, Renovation And Improvement Of Northside School; And For Related Purposes.

3005.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for construction of Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation headquarters in Ruleville.
3005.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With The Construction Of The Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation Headquarters In Ruleville, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3006.title: Appropriation; Marshall County for restoration of Isaac Chapel Rosenwald School.
3006.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Marshall County For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For The Preservation And Restoration Of The Isaac Chapel Rosenwald School Located In Marshall County, Mississippi, For The Fiscal Year 2021.

3007.title: Reappropriation; Small Business and Grocer Investment Act projects in Quitman County.
3007.description: An Act To Reappropriate Monies Out Of The Capital Expense Fund For Fiscal Year 2021, For The Small Business And Grocer Investment Act, For Projects In Quitman County, Mississippi, As Authorized In Senate Bill 3057, 2019 Regular Session.

3008.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist in the construction of a walking track in the northeast area of the City of Laurel.
3008.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Laurel In Paying The Costs Associated With The Construction Of A Walking Track In The Northeast Area Of The City; And For Related Purposes.

3009.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist in repair and renovation of Oak Park Alumni Building in the City of Laurel.
3009.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Of The Repair And Renovation Of The Oak Park Alumni Building In The City Of Laurel; And For Related Purposes.

3010.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Laurel in paying costs of flood control in Queensboro neighborhood.
3010.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Laurel, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Flood Control In The Queensboro Neighborhood Of The City; And For Related Purposes.

3011.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Jasper County in paying costs of repairs to certain county roads.
3011.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Jasper County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Leveling, Asphalt And Shoulder Work On Certain County Roads; And For Related Purposes.

3012.title: City of Oxford; change governing law for city trust fund investments from PERS to MS Uniform Prudent Investor Act.
3012.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 938, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Last Amended By Chapter 921, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Require The Board Of Trustees Of The City Of Oxford Municipal Reserve And Trust Fund To Invest The Fund In Accordance With The Mississippi Uniform Prudent Investor Act Instead Of In Any Of The Investments Authorized For The Public Employees' Retirement System Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3014.title: Tunica County; authorize contributions to the Tunica County Economic Development Foundation, Inc.
3014.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 928, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 934, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Chapter 919, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Tunica County Economic Development Foundation, Inc., Through Calendar Year 2024; And For Related Purposes.

3015.title: Appropriation; Dept. of Health for COVID-19 expenses incurred by hospitals for FY20 and FY21.
3015.description: An Act Making Appropriations From The Budget Contingency Fund To The Department Of Health To Defray Eligible Covid-19 Expenses Incurred By Hospitals For Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3016.title: Appropriation; Dept. of Finance and Administration for COVID-19 expenses incurred by municipalities and counties for FY 20 and FY 21.
3016.description: An Act Making Appropriations From The Budget Contingency Fund To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Defray Eligible Covid-19 Expenses For Municipalities And Counties For Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3017.title: Appropriation; Dept. of Education, IHL and Community Colleges for COVID-19 expenses for FY20 and FY21.
3017.description: An Act Making Appropriations From The Budget Contingency Fund To The Department Of Education, To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And The State Supported Institutions Of Higher Learning, And To The Community College Board And The Public Community And Junior Colleges To Defray Eligible Covid-19 Expenses For Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3018.title: Appropriation; Dept. of Finance and Administration for COVID 19 expenses for FY20 and FY21.
3018.description: An Act Making Appropriations From The Budget Contingency Fund And The Dfa Cares Act Covid-19 Fund To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Defray Eligible Covid-19 Expenses For Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3019.title: Infrastructure and Education Act; create.
3019.description: An Act To Levy A 0.4% Tax On Hotels And Motels, The Proceeds Of Which Are To Be Deposited In The State Treasury To The Credit Of The State Highway Fund; To Amend Sections 27-55-11, 27-55-519 And 27-55-521, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Excise Tax On Gasoline, Undyed Diesel Fuel And Certain Other Special Fuels By 12¢ Per Gallon; To Amend Section 27-115-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Public Education Fund To Replace The Lottery Proceeds Fund, And To Transfer All Monies In The Lottery Proceeds Fund Into The Public Education Fund; To Amend Sections 27-19-21 And 27-19-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Annual Tax On Electric And Hybrid Vehicles; To Amend Sections 27-5-101, 27-55-12, 27-55-523, 65-39-35 And 27-115-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Above; And For Related Purposes.

3020.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Houston with Houston Square Development Project.
3020.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Houston, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Houston Square Development Project, Including Creating New And Safer Crosswalks, Repairing Existing Crosswalks, Enhancing Landscaping And Lighting, And Transforming The Old Houston Movie Theater Into A Community Arts Space; And For Related Purposes.

3021.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Houston with improvements at Legion Lake Park.
3021.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Houston, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Improvements To Legion Lake Park, Including A Walking Track Around The Perimeter Of The Lake, A Fishing And Walking Bridge, Solar Lighting Along The Pathway, A Paved Parking Lot, And Four Pads For Rv Parking; And For Related Purposes.

3022.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Village of Pittsboro in paying costs of repairs to water tank.
3022.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Village Of Pittsboro, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Repairs To Its Water Tank; And For Related Purposes.

3023.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Chickasaw County in repair and renovation of Okolona and Houston courthouses.
3023.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Chickasaw County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of Its Courthouses In Okolona And Houston; And For Related Purposes.

3024.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Pontotoc County with upgrades to fire protection system in county industrial park.
3024.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Pontotoc County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Upgrades To The Fire Protection System In The Pontotoc County Industrial Park, Including Constructing An Elevated Water Storage Tank, Increasing Water Line Size, Installing Additional Fire Hydrants And Adding A Valve For Emergency Protection; And For Related Purposes.

3025.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist in construction of Multiuser Aero Strip at Stennis Airport in Hancock County.
3025.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In The Construction Of A Multiuser Aero Strip At Stennis Airport In Hancock County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3026.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Town of Ackerman with sidewalk repairs.
3026.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Ackerman, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Sidewalk Repairs; And For Related Purposes.

3027.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of D'Iberville in making certain roadway improvements.
3027.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of D'iberville, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Certain Roadway Improvements Including, But Not Limited To, The Construction Of A Four-lane Boulevard From Lamey Bridge Road To The Jackson County Line Connecting To Cook Road Corridor, And Associated Safety, Drainage, Aesthetic And Recreational Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

3028.title: Appropriation from State General Fund; to Department of Archives & History for renovation of Northside School for FY 2021.
3028.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of General Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History To Defray Expenses For The Remodel, Renovation And Improvement Of Northside School In West Point, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3029.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of $20 Million for interest-free loans to independent colleges in the state.
3029.description: An Act To Create The "2020 Covid-19 Mississippi Independent College And University Loan Fund"; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Loans To Certain Independent Undergraduate Colleges And Universities Within The State; To Create A Bond Sinking Fund, From Which The Principal Of And Interest On Such Bonds Shall Be Paid By Appropriation, And Into Which All Monies Received From The Colleges And Universities In Repayment Of The Principal Of The Loans Authorized Under This Act Shall Be Deposited; To Set Out Conditions To Which The Colleges And Universities Must Agree In Order To Be Eligible For The Loans; To Provide That, Of The Amount Disbursed In Loans, Half Shall Be Divided Equally Among The Eligible Colleges And Universities, With The Remainder Divided Pro Rata Based On The Total Enrollment Data Reported To The Integrated Postsecondary Education System (ipeds) Maintained By The United States Department Of Education National Center For Education Statistics For The Two Most Recently Reported School Years; And For Related Purposes.

3030.title: Capitol Complex Improvement District; increase DFA's borrowing authority and divert use tax revenue for.
3030.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-215, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Borrowing Authority Of The Department Of Finance And Administration, From $7,000,000.00 To $14,000,000.00, For The Purpose Of Paying The Costs Of Implementing And Administering The Improvement Projects In The Capitol Complex Improvement District Comprehensive Plan, And To Add Use Tax Revenue As A Source Of Funding For The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Fund; To Amend Section 27-67-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Divert To The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Fund A Certain Portion Of Use Tax Revenue Based On The Percentage Of The Mississippi Population Residing In The City Of Jackson; And For Related Purposes.

3031.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Meridian in road construction and improvements for Sela Ward Parkway Project.
3031.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Meridian, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With Road Construction And Improvements For The Sela Ward Parkway Project; And For Related Purposes.

3032.title: Appropriation from special funds; to Department of Transportation for repairs to Longleaf Trace for FY2021.
3032.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Defray Expenses Of The Pearl And Leaf Rivers Rails-to-trails Recreational District For Bridge Repairs And Trail Overlay Repairs On The Longleaf Trace For Fiscal Year 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3033.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Lawrence County in paying costs of new frontage road construction.
3033.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Lawrence County In Paying The Costs Associated With The Construction Of A New Frontage Road; And For Related Purposes.

3034.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Brookhaven in paying costs of reconstruction of Brookway Boulevard segment.
3034.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Brookhaven, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Reconstruction Of A Segment Of Brookway Boulevard; And For Related Purposes.

3035.title: Appropriation FY2021; to Pascagoula Redevelopment Authority for Gulf Coast Singing River Innovation Center.
3035.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Pascagoula Redevelopment Authority To Defray Expenses For Development Of The Gulf Coast Singing River Innovation Center For Fiscal Year 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3036.title: Suffrage for Marty Langley.
3036.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Marty Langley Of Lincoln County, Mississippi.

3037.title: City of Gautier; allow low-speed vehicles and golf carts on certain public roads.
3037.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart Or Low-speed Vehicle To Have A Valid Driver's License And Proof Of Insurance; To Require Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts To Be Registered With The City; To Authorize The City To Charge A Registration Fee; And For Related Purposes.

3038.title: Restore suffrage to Dexter Foster.
3038.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Dexter Foster Of Lee County, Mississippi.

3039.title: Jackson County; authorize to purchase radar speed detection equipment for use by sheriff or county in enforcing speed laws on county roads.
3039.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Purchase Radar Speed Detection Equipment For Use By The Sheriff And Deputies In Enforcing The Speed Laws Of The County Roads Of Jackson County; And For Related Purposes.

3040.title: City of Jackson; authorize city to adopt ordinance to permit motor-assisted scooters to operate on certain city streets.
3040.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Designate By Ordinance The Roads And Streets, Together With Sidewalks And Bicycle Paths And Lanes, Upon Which Motor-assisted Scooters May Be Operated; And For Related Purposes.

3041.title: Rankin County; authorize board of supervisors to buy radar equipment for sheriff and deputies to use outside municipalities.
3041.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Rankin County, Mississippi, To Purchase Radar Speed Detection Equipment For Use By The Sheriff And Deputies In Enforcing The Speed Laws Of The County Roads Of Rankin County; And For Related Purposes.

3042.title: City of Gautier; authorize to levy 1% sales tax on retailers at Singing River Mall site for improvements to mall site.
3042.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Assessment In The Amount Of 1% Of The Total Retail Sales Generated By The Operations Of Each Tenant, Owner Or Occupier Of The Singing River Mall Site, For The Purposes Of Providing Funds For The Acquisition, Construction, Reconstruction, Expansion, Improvement, Furnishing, Equipping, Maintaining And Repairing Of Properties, Infrastructure And Improvements To The Singing River Mall Site; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

3043.title: Lauderdale County; authorize assessments on misdemeanor convictions and nonadjudications for county government complex.
3043.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County, Mississippi, To Levy An Assessment, In Addition To Any Other Assessments And Court Costs, For Civil Cases Filed And Misdemeanor Convictions And/or Nonadjudications Obtained In Its Justice Court, To Be Used To Fund The Construction, Operation, Furnishing, Technology, Maintenance And Related Needs Of A New County Office Building To Be Known As The "lauderdale County Government Complex"; And For Related Purposes.

3044.title: City of Olive Branch; authorize 1% tax on hotels and motels for tourism and parks and recreation.
3044.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Olive Branch, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals For The Purposes Of Tourism And Parks And Recreation; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

3045.title: City of Charleston; authorize to issue notes.
3045.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Charleston, Mississippi, To Issue Notes For A Certain Purpose And To Provide That Such Notes Shall Be Financed Up To Fifteen Years; And For Related Purposes.

3046.title: Marshall County; authorize to employ additional, part-time assistant county prosecuting attorneys.
3046.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Employ Additional, Part-time Assistant County Prosecuting Attorneys As Determined Necessary, To Designate The Responsibilities Of Such Attorneys, And To Pay Such Attorneys An Annual Salary Or Appearance Fee Not To Exceed 90% Of The Amount Paid To The Elected Prosecuting Attorney Of The County; To Require That The Salary Authorized By The Board For Additional, Part-time Assistant County Prosecuting Attorneys Be The Sole And Complete Salary Paid By The County For Such Attorneys; And For Related Purposes.

3048.title: Equity in Distance Learning Act; enact.
3048.description: An Act To Establish The "equity In Distance Learning Act" To Be Administered By The Mississippi Department Of Education To Provide Guidance, Technical Support And Financial Reimbursement To Schools To Provide Distance Learning And Online Services; To Provide For Certain Transfers By The State Fiscal Officer; To State Legislative Findings And Intent; To Define Terms; To Establish The "equity In Distance Learning Grant Program"; To Provide That Allocations Under The Program Shall Be Made Based On Average Daily Membership; To Highly Encourage Each School To Commit A Portion Of Its Federal Elementary And Secondary School Emergency Relief (esser) Funds To Purchase Equipment For Its Distance Learning Plan; To Require The Department To Inform Each School Of Its Portion Of Available Funds, To Develop Regulations And Procedures To Govern The Grant Program, And To Compile An Express Products List; To Prescribe The Eligibility Requirements For Schools To Be Reimbursed Under The Grant Program; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "equity In Distance Learning Fund"; To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Purchases Under The Grant Program Created Under This Act And The Directive That School Districts Create A Distance Learning Plan And Fulfill Technology Needs Expeditiously Shall Be Deemed An Emergency Purchase For Purposes Of The Procurement And Competitive Bidding Law; To Provide That The Provisions Of This Act Are Severable; And For Related Purposes.

3049.title: Suffrage; Azalean Jones Rogers.
3049.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Azalean Jones Rogers Of Bolivar County, Mississippi.

3050.title: COVID-19 Broadband Grant Programs; create.
3050.description: An Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer $65,000,000.00 To The Mississippi Electric Cooperatives Broadband Covid-19 Grant Program Fund; To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer $10,000,000.00 To The Covid-19 Broadband Provider Grant Program Fund; To Create The "mississippi Electric Cooperatives Broadband Covid-19 Grant Program" And The "covid-19 Broadband Provider Grant Program"; To Provide A Statement Of Legislative Intent And Findings; To Create The "mississippi Electric Cooperatives Broadband Covid-19 Grant Program Fund" And The "covid-19 Broadband Provider Grant Program Fund" As Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For Grants Under This Act; To Provide That The Grant Programs Created Under This Act Shall Be Administered By The Department Of Finance And Administration, For The Purpose Of Making Grants Under This Act For Eligible Expenses; To Prescribe The Requirements Of Application For The Grants; To Specify That The Use Of Grant Funds Shall Be Subject To Audit And Regulation Of The Public Utilities Staff, And Noncompliance With The Terms Of The Grant Shall Require Repayment Of Grant Monies To The State; To Specify That All Monies Shall Be Disbursed From These Special Funds In Compliance With The Requirements Of The Cares Act And Guidelines From The United States Department Of The Treasury Regarding The Use Of Monies From The Coronavirus Relief Fund; To Transfer Unobligated Monies In The Funds As Of October 1, 2020, To The Unemployment Insurance Fund; To Provide That A Declaration Of Any Portion Of This Act As Invalid Shall Not Affect The Remaining Portions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3051.title: The Mississippi County and Municipality Emergency Relief Program; establish.
3051.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi County And Municipality Emergency Relief Program Which Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency To Reimburse Counties And Municipalities For Eligible Expenditures Incurred In Response To The Covid-19 Pandemic; To Define Terms; To Define The Term "eligible Expenditure" According To The United States Treasury Guidelines; To Require The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency To Promulgate Regulations And Develop Procedures To Govern The Administration Of The Program, Including A Reimbursement Process; To Provide That The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency May Retain A Certain Amount Of Funds To Administer The Program; To Require Participating Counties And Municipalities To Submit A Certified Application And An Itemized Receipt And/or Invoice In Order To Be Reimbursed; To Describe The Distribution Of Funds To Counties And Municipalities; To Provide That The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency Shall Disburse The Funds To Counties And Municipalities As Authorized By This Act From The Covid-19 Fund (fund Number 5820200000); To Provide That The Provisions Of This Act Are Severable; And For Related Purposes.

3052.title: Ad valorem taxes; extend deadline for free port warehouses to submit required inventory to tax assessor due to COVID-19.
3052.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, If A Licensed Free Port Warehouse Failed To Submit The Inventory Required To Be Filed With The Tax Assessor By The March 31, 2020, Deadline, Due To A Required Or Voluntary Closure Of The Business, A Furlough, Layoff Or Other Reduction In Staff Operations, Or The Closure Of County Government Offices Related To Coronavirus Disease 2019 (covid-19), Such Free Port Warehouse May Submit The Required Inventory By July 1, 2020; And For Related Purposes.

3053.title: Mississippi Back-to-Business Liability Assurance and Health Care Emergency Response Liability Protection Act; create.
3053.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Back-to-business Liability Assurance And Health Care Emergency Response Liability Protection Act; To Provide Immunity From Suit And Liability To Health Care Providers And Health Care Facilities That Provide Care During A State Of Emergency And Certain Circumstances; To Define Duty Of Care For Premises Owners; To Provide Immunity From Suit And Liability For Individuals, State And Local Government, Associations, For-profit And Nonprofit Entities, Religious And Charitable Organizations; To Provide Safe Harbor Compliance With Public Health Guidance; To Provide Immunity From Suit And Liability For Products Made, Sold Or Donated In Response To Covid-19 And Related Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

3054.title: Mississippi Public Health and Welfare Emergency Relief Act; enact.
3054.description: An Act To Enact The "mississippi Public Health And Welfare Emergency Relief Act"; To State Legislative Findings And Intent; To Define Terms; To Require The State Department Of Health To Promulgate Regulations And Develop Procedures To Govern The Administration Of The Programs Created By This Act; To Require The State Department Of Health To Make An Initial Disbursement To Eligible Applicants By August 15, 2020, Subject To Appropriation By The Legislature; To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Request Personnel Or Systems Support Of Any Political Subdivision Of The State; To Require Any Political Subdivision Of The State To Comply With A Request From The State Department Of Health; To Allow The State Department Of Health To Retain A Certain Percentage Of The Funds Available Under This Act; To Describe The Qualifications For Eligibility Under The Programs Established Under This Act; To Require An Applicant To Provide A Certified Application To The State Department Of Health And The Original Itemized Receipt And/or Invoice Of Purchases And Services Paid In Order To Receive Reimbursement; To Provide That No Applicant Shall Receive Reimbursement For Expenditures That Have Been Reimbursed From Another Source Of Funds; To Establish The Hospital Cares Act Program To Reimburse Hospitals For Eligible Expenditures; To Establish The Independent Physician Cares Act Program To Reimburse Independent Physicians For Eligible Expenditures; To Establish The Independent Dentist Cares Act Program To Reimburse Independent Dentists For Eligible Expenditures; To Mandate That The State Department Of Health Shall Not Exceed A Set Sum In Reimbursement For Each Independent Physician Or Dentist; To Establish The Ambulance Cares Act Program To Reimburse Ambulance Providers For Eligible Expenditures; To Mandate That The State Department Of Health Shall Not Exceed A Set Sum Per Registered Ambulance In Reimbursement To An Ambulance Provider; To Establish The Food Pantry Cares Act Program To Reimburse Food Pantries For Eligible Expenditures; To Allow The State Department Of Health To Reimburse Entities Acting On Behalf Of The Food Pantry Or Providing A Service To A Food Pantry; To Establish The Nonprofit Cares Act Program To Reimburse Nonprofits For Eligible Expenditures; To Require The State Department Of Health To Distribute To The Community Foundations A Pro Rata Share Of The Funds Under This Program Based On The Population Served By The Foundation; To Require The Community Foundations To Disburse The Funds As Grants For Nonprofits Which Have Incurred Eligible Expenditures; To Mandate That The Grants To Nonprofits Shall Not Exceed A Certain Sum; To Establish The Multiagency Procurement Of Covid-19-related Materials Cares Act Program To Procure A Statewide Stockpile Of Covid-19-related Materials; To Require The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency, The Mississippi Development Authority And The State Department Of Health To Cooperate To Encourage Manufacturers Of Covid-19-related Materials In Mississippi To Provide Long-term Access For Mississippi; To Require The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency To Purchase Covid-19-related Materials; To Establish The Nursing Homes Cares Act Program To Reimburse Nursing Homes For Eligible Expenditures; To Establish The Medical Provider Cares Act Program To Reimburse The Medical Providers Who Are Not Provided For In A Separate Program In This Act For Eligible Expenditures; To Establish The Child Care Facilities Cares Act Program To Reimburse Child Care Facilities For Eligible Expenditures; To Establish The Community Mental Health Centers Cares Act Program To Reimburse Community Mental Health Centers For Eligible Expenditures; To Establish The Mississippi Home Corporation Cares Act Program To Provide Rental Assistance To Persons Affected By Covid-19; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "public Health And Welfare Emergency Relief Fund"; To Require The Department To Report To The Legislature And The Governor On The Utilization Of The Programs Created By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3055.title: Unemployment compensation; create special provisions for 2021 general and individual experience rates due to COVID-19.
3055.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The General Experience Rate For 2021 Shall Be 0%; To Provide That Charges Attributed To Each Employer's Individual Experience Rate For The Period March 8, 2020, Through June 30, 2020, Will Not Impact The Employer's Individual Experience Rate Calculations For Purposes Of Calculating The Total Unemployment Insurance Rate For 2021 And The Two Subsequent Tax Rate Years; To Provide That Charges Attributed To Each Employer's Individual Experience Rate For The Period July 1, 2020, Through December 31, 2020, Will Not Impact The Employer's Individual Experience Rate Calculations For Purposes Of Calculating The Total Unemployment Insurance Rate For 2022 And The Two Subsequent Tax Rate Years; To Amend Section 71-5-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Contribution Collections For The State Workforce Investment, Mississippi Works And Mississippi Workforce Enhancement Training Funds Shall Not Be Suspended For Tax Rate Year 2021, And The Resulting Contribution Rate Of .20% Shall Be Added To The Employer's General And Individual Experience Rate To Obtain The Total Unemployment Insurance Rate For 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3056.title: Driver's licenses; credit time of inability to apply due to COVID-19 closures toward period for holding prerequisite permit.
3056.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Shortening Of The Requisite Period For Possession Of A Learner's Permit Or Intermediate License, In Certain Circumstances Involving Covid-19 Closures, Before An Applicant May Qualify For An Intermediate License Or Driver's License, Respectively; To Amend Section 7, Chapter 467, Laws Of 2019, To Revise The Effective Date Of The Mississippi First Responders Health And Safety Act; To Amend Section 25-15-409, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Date By Which The State, Municipality, County Or Fire Protection District Must Show Proof Of Insurance Coverage That Meets The Requirements Of The Mississippi First Responders Health And Safety Act; And For Related Purposes.

3057.title: Coronavirus relief monies; amend certain provisions pertaining to small business relief.
3057.description: An Act To Amend Senate Bill No. 2772, 2020 Regular Session, To Include Fiscal Year 2021 Along With Fiscal Year 2020 As The Time Period In Which The Department Of Finance And Administration Shall Have The Authority To Receive, Budget And Escalate Certain Federal Funds In The Dfa Cares Act Covid-19 Fund For Defraying Expenses Incurred By Any State Agency, Department Or Institution For The Purposes Provided Under The Coronavirus Relief Fund, Section 5001 Of The Federal Cares Act; To Clarify Legislative Findings Regarding The Purpose Of The $2,000.00 Direct Payment To Businesses For Initial Compliance With The Governor's State Of Emergency Covid-19 Proclamation Issued On March 14, 2020; To Add Certain North American Industry Classification System Codes To The Definition Of An Eligible Taxpayer For The $2,000.00 Direct Payment From The Mississippi Covid-19 Relief Payment Fund; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Not Consider Applications Filed After September 15, 2020, For The Back To Business Mississippi Grant Program; To Increase The Base Payment To An Eligible Business Under The Back To Business Mississippi Grant Program From $1,500.00 To $3,500.00; To Remove The Provision Requiring That The Total Payment Under The Back To Business Mississippi Grant Program Shall Be Reduced For Paycheck Protection Program Funds, Economic Injury Disaster Loan Emergency Advance Funds, And Business Interruption Insurance Proceeds Received By The Eligible Business; To Specify That The Amount Of A Payment Under The Back To Business Mississippi Grant Program Shall Not Be Reduced By $2,000.00 For Any Direct Payment Received From The Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

3058.title: MS Electric Cooperatives Broadband COVID-19 Grant Program; authorize tertiary applications/create special fund.
3058.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 487, 2020 Regular Session (senate Bill No. 3046), To Create The "public Utilities Application Fund," To Change The Application Fee Deposits From "public Utilities Staff Regulation Fund" To The "public Utilities Application Fund," And To Authorize A Third Round Of Applications For The Mississippi Electric Cooperatives Broadband Covid-19 Grant Program; And For Related Purposes.

3059.title: The Mississippi ICU Infrastructure Act; enact.
3059.description: An Act To Establish The "mississippi Icu Infrastructure Act" To Be Administered By The Mississippi Department Of Health To Provide Funds To Hospitals To Increase Treatment Capacity Related To The Covid-19 Pandemic; To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Health To Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Govern The Administration Of The Program; To Establish Certain Conditions On The Use Of Funds Under The Program; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury For Program Funds; To Set Certain Requirements On The Use And Acceptance Of Funds Under The Program; To Require The Department Of Health To Report On The Status Of The Program; To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Construction Or Addition Of Intensive Care Units, Isolation Rooms, Or Negative Pressure Rooms Funded From This Program From The Provisions Of The Healthcare Certificate Of Need Law; And For Related Purposes.

3060.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act; automatically schedule any federally-scheduled, COVID-19 drug.
3060.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Drug That Is Scheduled On The Federal Schedule For The Purpose Of Preventing Or Treating Covid-19 Is Automatically Scheduled On The Corresponding State Schedule; To Amend Section 41-29-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Approved Cannabidiol Drugs From Schedule V; And For Related Purposes.

3061.title: Mississippi Pandemic Response Broadband Availability Act; authorize grant monies to be expended on prepaid services.
3061.description: An Act To Amend Section 4, Chapter 491, Laws Of 2020 (house Bill No. 1788), To Authorize Funds Appropriated And Grant Monies Distributed Under The Mississippi Pandemic Response Broadband Availability Grant Program To Be Expended On A License To Use Equipment And Services For A Period Of No Longer Than One (1) Year As Necessary To Fulfill The Purposes Of The Program; And For Related Purposes.

3062.title: The Mississippi Agriculture Stabilization Act; enact.
3062.description: An Act To Transfer Funds Out Of The Budget Contingency Fund To The "poultry Farmer Stabilization Grant Program Fund," The "mississippi Supplemental Cfap Grant Program Fund" And The "sweet Potato Farm Sustainment Grant Program Fund"; To Establish The "mississippi Agriculture Stabilization Act" To Be Administered By The Mississippi Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Assist Mississippi Poultry Farmers Who Have Experienced A Loss Of At Least One (1) Full Flock Of Production Due To The Covid-19 Pandemic; To Assist Commodity Producers Who Qualified For The Usda Coronavirus Food Assistance Program; To Assist Sweet Potato Farmers For Expenses Due To The Covid-19 Pandemic; To Allow The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Govern The Administration And Eligibility Requirements Of The Programs Established In The Act; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "poultry Farmer Stabilization Grant Program Fund"; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Known As The "mississippi Supplemental Coronavirus Food Assistance Program Grant Program Fund"; To Transfer Unexpended Funds To The Unemployment Compensation Fund; To Provide That The Provisions Of This Act Are Severable; And For Related Purposes.

3063.title: Appropriation; Veterans Affairs Bd.-CARES Act.
3063.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From The Budget Contingency Fund To The Veterans' Affairs Board To Defray Eligible Covid-19 Expenses For Fiscal Year 2021; And For Related Purposes.

3064.title: Appropriation; ICU Infrastructure Fund -COVID-19.
3064.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From The “icu Infrastructure Fund” To The State Department Of Health To Administer The “mississippi Intensive Care Infrastructure Act” Created To Increase Hospital Capacity Related To The Covid-19 Pandemic; And For Related Purposes.

3065.title: Appropriation; Poultry Farmer Grant Program Fund, Covid-19.
3065.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From The "poultry Farmer Stabilization Grant Program Fund", The "mississippi Supplemental Cfap Grant Program Fund", And The “sweet Potato Farm Sustainment Grant Program Fund” To The State Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Administer The Grant Programs Created To Provide Funding To Farmers Impacted By The Covid-19 Pandemic; And For Related Purposes.

3066.title: Absentee Voter Law; authorize 2020 electors to vote by in-person absentee and remove notary requirements.
3066.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-713, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize All Duly Qualified Electors To Vote By Absentee Ballot In Person For The 2020 General Election Due To The Covid-19 Pandemic; To Amend Sections 23-15-627, 23-15-631, 23-15-635, 23-15-641, 23-15-719, 23-15-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Notary Requirement For Mail-in Applications And Ballots; And For Related Purposes.

3067.title: Appropriation; revise appropriation addressing the public health emergency due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
3067.description: An Act To Amend Section 2, Chapter 104, Laws Of 2020, To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Provide Funds To Ambulatory Surgical Centers Certified By The State Department Of Health, To Allow Ground Ambulances To Seek Reimbursement For Any Eligible Expenditure As Defined By The Act, To Revise Administrative Expenses For The Community Foundations, To Clarify The Definition Of The Term "nonprofit Entity," To Increase The Amount Awarded To Food Pantries After A Certain Date, And To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Reallocate Undisbursed Funds On A Certain Date To Child Care Facilities; To Amend Section 7, Chapter 104, Laws Of 2020, To Revise The Appropriation Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

3068.title: Adopt permanent rules of the Senate.
3068.description: A Resolution Providing For The Permanent Rules Of The Senate.

3069.title: Commend Senate service of Senator Debbie Dawkins.
3069.description: A Resolution To Commend And Recognize District 48 State Senator Deborah (debbie) Dawkins For Her Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3070.title: Commend Senate service of Senator Chris Massey.
3070.description: A Resolution To Commend And Recognize District 1 State Senator Chris Massey For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3071.title: Senate Rules; amend Rule 65 to provide for removal of members of the Rules Committee.
3071.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule 65 To Provide For The Removal Of Members Of The Rules Committee.

3072.title: Commend Delta Sigma Theta Sorority at Delta Days in the Capitol.
3072.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Membership Of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority On The Occasion Of Mississippi Delta Days At The Capitol In 2020.

3073.title: Paying tribute to the memory of respected Morton Physician and Community Leader Dr. Howard D. Clark, M.D.
3073.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Paying Tribute To The Memory Of Respected Morton Physician And Community Stalwart Dr. Howard D. Clark, M.d., And Extending The Sympathy Of The Senate To His Bereaved Family.

3074.title: Recognize 75th Anniversary of Resurrection Catholic School Annual Carnival Ball.
3074.description: A Resolution Recognizing The 75th Anniversary Celebration Of The Resurrection Catholic School Annual Carnival Ball In Pascagoula, Mississippi.

3075.title: Recognize "Mississippi Links Day at the Capitol."
3075.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Links, Incorporated, On The Observance Of The "mississippi Links Day At The Capitol 2020" For Their Outstanding Service To The Community.

3076.title: Commend St. Andrew's Episcopal "Lady Saints" Soccer Team for winning the State Championship.
3076.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Andrew's Episcopal School Lady Saints Soccer Team And Head Coach Will Monsour Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association 1a/2a/3a Girls Soccer State Championship.

3077.title: Welcome NASA Astronaut Colonel Douglas Wheelock on Stennis Space Center Capitol Day.
3077.description: A Resolution Welcoming Nasa Astronaut Douglas H. Wheelock, Retired Colonel Of The United States Army, To The State Of Mississippi On The Occasion Of The Partners For Stennis Space Center Capitol Day.

3078.title: Commend Super Bowl Kansas City Chiefs' Offensive Tackle Martinas Rankin.
3078.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Nfl Super Bowl Liv Champion Kansas City Chiefs' Football Offensive Tackle Martinas Orlando Rankin Who Was A Standout At Mendenhall High School And Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

3079.title: Celebrate 37th Anniversary of diplomatic relationship between Mississippi and Taiwan.
3079.description: A Resolution Encouraging Further Economic Ties And Friendship Between The State Of Mississippi And The Republic Of China (taiwan).

3080.title: Commend Ole Miss Hockey Club for winning its first SEC title in school history.
3080.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The University Of Mississippi "ole Miss" Ice Hockey Club For Winning Its First Southeastern Conference Hockey Club Tournament Title In Program History.

3081.title: Recognize Richard H. McNeel as the 2020 Mississippi State University Alumnus of the Year for the College of Architecture.
3081.description: A Resolution Recognizing Richard H. Mcneel Of Jackson, Mississippi, As The 2020 Mississippi State University Alumnus Of The Year For The College Of Architecture, Art And Design, And Extending The Congratulations Of The Mississippi Senate.

3082.title: Commend Gulfport High School "Lady Admirals" Girls Soccer Team for winning State Championship.
3082.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Gulfport High School "lady Admirals" Girls Soccer Team And Coach Chris Pryor For Winning Their Second State Championship.

3083.title: Commend MS Gulf Coast Community College "Bulldogs" Football Team for winning 2019 NJCAA National Title.
3083.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College "bulldogs" Football Team And Head Coach Jack Wright For Winning The 2019 Njcaa National Title.

3084.title: Recognize Talking Book Services on 50th Anniversary.
3084.description: A Resolution Recognizing Talking Book Services, The Statewide Library Service For Mississippians With Visual, Physical Or Organic Reading Disabilities, Which Is Housed At The Mississippi Library Commission, For 50 Years Of Service On July 1, 2020.

3085.title: Commend the life of Greenville Community activist Ruthie Mae Ransom Morris and extending condolences of the Senate.
3085.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Extending The Condolences Of The Mississippi Senate To The Bereaved Family Of Respected Greenville Citizen And Democratic Party Activist Ruthie Mae Ransom Morris.

3086.title: Recognize former JSU President Dr. John Arthur Peoples, Jr., and Mrs. Mary Peoples for contributions to higher education in MS.
3086.description: A Resolution Paying Tribute And Extending The Appreciation Of The Legislature To Former Jackson State University President Dr. John Arthur Peoples, Jr., And Mrs. Mary Peoples For Their Legacy Of Contributions To Higher Education In The State Of Mississippi.

3087.title: Commend Center Hill High School "Lady Mustangs" Volleyball Team for 2019 Class 5A State Championship.
3087.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Center Hill High School "lady Mustangs" Volley Ball Team And Coach Robbie Veazey For Winning The 2019 Class 5a State Championship.

3088.title: Recognize Arielle Hudson of Tunica as first African American female recipient of Rhodes Scholarship at University of MS.
3088.description: A Resolution Extending The Recognition And Congratulations Of The Mississippi Senate To Arielle Hudson Of Tunica, Mississippi, The First African American Female At The University Of Mississippi To Receive The Prestigious Rhodes Scholarship.

3089.title: Commend 2020 Center Hill High School "Mustangs" Boys Soccer Team for first-ever 5A State Championship.
3089.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2020 Center Hill High School "mustangs" Boys Soccer Team And Coach Andrew Yeoman For Winning Their First-ever State 5a Championship.

3090.title: Commend Holmes Community College "Lady Bulldogs" Soccer Team for State and Regional Championships.
3090.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Holmes Community College "lady Bulldogs" Soccer Team And Head Coach Matt Convertino For Their 2019 Mississippi Association Of Community Colleges State Championship And Their 2019 National Junior College Athletic Association Regional Championship.

3091.title: Commend Coahoma High School "Red Panthers" Boys Basketball Team for winning their third 2A State Championship in four years.
3091.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Coahoma High School "red Panthers" Boys Basketball Team And Coach Derrick Moore For Winning Their Third Class 2a State Championship In Four Years.

3092.title: Commend Olive Branch High School "Lady Quistors" Basketball Team for winning second straight 6A State Championship.
3092.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Olive Branch High School "lady Quistors" Basketball Team And Coach Jason Thompson For Winning Their Second Consecutive Mississippi High School Activities Association 6a State Championship.

3093.title: Commend 2019-2020 Simpson Academy "Cougars" Boys Basketball Team for first-ever MAIS Overall State Championship.
3093.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2019-2020 Simpson County Academy "cougars" Boys Basketball Team And Coach James Crain For Winning Their First-ever Mais Overall State Championship.

3094.title: Recognize career and culinary success of Chef Nick Wallace.
3094.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Outstanding Career And Culinary Success Of Mississippi Chef Extraordinaire Nick Wallace.

3095.title: Commend John Miller for being named "Instructor of the Year" at the Jackson County Campus of the MS Gulf Coast Community College.
3095.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating John Miller For Being Selected As "instructor Of The Year" At The Jackson County Campus Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

3096.title: Commend JoAnne Daniels for being named Jefferson Davis Campus of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College "Instructor of the Year."
3096.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Joanne Daniels For Being Selected As "instructor Of The Year" At The Jefferson Davis Campus Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

3097.title: Commend Ms. Angela Butler for being named "Instructor of the Year" at the Perkinston Campus of MS Gulf Coast Community College.
3097.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Angela Butler For Being Selected As "instructor Of The Year" At The Perkinston Campus Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College.

3098.title: Commend Phi Beta Lambda business students at Co-Lin for State Leadership Conference awards.
3098.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Phi Beta Lambda Business Students At Copiah-lincoln Community College For Their Outstanding Awards Earned At The State Leadership Conference Held At Mississippi University For Women On February 26-28, 2020.

3099.title: Recognize Dr. Kara Blackard, Pastor of Wheeler Grove Baptist Church.
3099.description: A Resolution Commending, Congratulating And Honoring The Christian Leadership Of Dr. Kara Blackard, Pastor Of Wheeler Grove Baptist Church In Corinth, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Pastorate.

3100.title: Commend Jobs for Mississippi Graduates student's success at JAG National Student Leadership Academy.
3100.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Gentry High School Students And "jobs For Mississippi Graduates" Participants: A'myah Robinson, Sylvester Washington, Jr., Colee M. Anthony And T'rossi Pernell, And Jackson School District Academic And Performing Arts Complex Program Student, Zacchaeus Wallace, Upon Their Success At The Jobs For America's Graduates National Student Leadership Academy.

3101.title: Recognize public service of Steven Allen, Deputy Executive Director of MS Department of Mental Health.

3200.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending Certain Provisions Of Joint Rule No. 40 For The Purpose Of Further Consideration And Passage Of Senate Bill No. 2772 (2020 Regular Session) Entitled "an Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Make Transfers Of Certain Funds; To Provide That The Department Of Finance And Administration Shall Not Be Authorized To Escalate Certain Funds During Fiscal Year 2021; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Escalate Certain Funds During Fiscal Year 2020; And For Related Purposes."

3201.title: Commend Nancy Lane from Brandon, Mississippi, upon her election as Treasurer for the National Association of REALTORS®.
3201.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Nancy Lane From Brandon, Mississippi, Upon Her Election As The Treasurer For The National Association Of Realtors® (nar), And Extending The Recognition Of The Legislature To Her As The First Mississippian Elected To The Executive Committee Of America's Largest Trade Association.

3202.title: Suspend rules; establish program for medical marijuana as authorized by Legislative alternative to Initiative No. 65.
3202.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Establish A Program To Allow The Medical Use Of Marijuana Products By Qualified Persons With Debilitating Medical Conditions As Authorized Under New Article 16, Section 290 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Offered By The Mississippi Legislature As An Alternative To Initiative Measure No. 65; And For Related Purposes."

3203.title: Urge United States Congress to provide funding to all Mississippi municipalities to fight COVID-19 pandemic.
3203.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The United States Congress To Support Direct Federal Funding To All Municipalities In Mississippi To Help Fight Covid-19 And Protect Local Citizens From The Effects Of The Novel Coronavirus.

3204.title: Paying tribute to the memory of veteran Mississippi Highway Patrolman and Sheriff Weston Hampton Birdsong, Jr., of Grenada.
3204.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Memory Of Veteran Mississippi Highway Patrolman And Grenada County Sheriff Weston Hampton "birdie" Birdsong, Jr., Of Grenada, Mississippi, And Remembering His Legacy Of Service.

3205.title: Suspend rules for drafting, etc.; transfer certain CARES ACT monies to MDA for a local government grant program.
3205.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Transfer Out Of The Budget Contingency Fund The Sum Of $562,000,000.00 To The Mississippi Development Authority Pursuant To The Federal Cares Act Regulations Dated May 28, 2020, Which Mandate That 45% Of The State's Total Allotment Shall Be Reserved For Direct Payments To Units Of Local Governments; To Direct The Mississippi Development Authority To Develop A Grant Program To Distribute Such Funds To Local Governments Consistent With Such Regulations For Any Expenses Related To The Covid-19 Public Health Emergency That Have Been Incurred Or Will Be Incurred By Local Governments, Including, But Not Limited To, Expenses For Public Safety, Public Health, Health Care, Human Services, Hazard Pay For Individuals, And Personal Protective Equipment; And For Related Purposes."

3206.title: Commend the life of Robert Jerry "Gentle Ben" Williams, the first African American to play football at Ole Miss.
3206.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature To The Surviving Family Of Robert Jerry "gentle Ben" Williams Of Yazoo City, Mississippi, The First African American To Play Football At The University Of Mississippi And One Of The Greatest Defensive Players In The School's History, And Commending His Civic Contributions.

3207.title: Article V Constitutional Convention; provide for selection and authority of commissioners.
3207.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Provide For The Selection And Authority Of Commissioners To Attend An Article V Convention Called For Proposing Amendments To The United States Constitution.

3208.title: Suspend rules for further consideration of SB 2446; revise the design of the official state flag.
3208.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of The Further Consideration And Passage Of Senate Bill No. 2446, 2020 Regular Session, Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 3-3-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Design Of The Official Flag Of The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes."

3209.title: Commend former State Health Officer Dr. Alton Cobb for receiving the 2020 MS Academy of Family Physicians Humanitarian Award.
3209.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Alton B. Cobb, Former State Health Officer, Upon His Receipt Of The Prestigious Mississippi Academy Of Family Physicians Humanitarian Award For 2020 And For His Decades Of Public Health Service.

3210.title: Declare the month of October as Metastatic Breast Cancer Awareness Month.
3210.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring The Month Of October 2020 As Metastatic Breast Cancer Awareness Month.

3211.title: Commend life and public service of former Senator and Representative Malcolm Mabry of Dublin, Mississippi.
3211.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator And Representative Malcolm Mabry, Jr., Of Dublin, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3212.title: Congratulate JSU viral star Thomas "Snacks" Lee for winning the ESPY Award for "Can't-Stop-Watching-Moment of the Year."
3212.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Jackson State University Viral Star Thomas "snacks" Lee For Winning The Espy Award For The "can't-stop-watching-moment Of The Year."

3213.title: Recognize JSU Athletic Director Ashley Robinson as the first African American President of FSC ADA.
3213.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Ashley Robinson, Vice President And Director Of Athletics At Jackson State University, As The First African American Selected As President Of The Division I Football Championship Subdivision Athletics Directors Association.

3214.title: Suspend rules for drafting, introduction; designate Juneteenth as official state holiday.
3214.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 3-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate June 19th As An Official State Holiday In Recognition Of Juneteenth, Commemorating The End Of Slavery In The United States; And For Related Purposes."

3215.title: Salute the early auto dealers and African American legends of the automobile industry in Jackson, Mississippi.
3215.description: A Concurrent Resolution Saluting And Memorializing The Generation Of Businessmen And Community Leaders That Established A Vibrant Automotive Marketplace In Jackson, Mississippi, Following World War Ii And The African American Legends And Success Stories In The Automotive Business In This Market During The Early 1970s And Their Civic Contributions.

3216.title: Recognize 50th Anniversary of Talking Book Services at the MS Library Commission.
3216.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending Talking Book Services, The Statewide Library Service For Mississippians With Visual, Physical Or Organic Reading Disabilities, Which Is Housed At The Mississippi Library Commission, On 50 Years Of Service On July 1, 2020.

3217.title: Commend the life of iconic physician Dr. William Briggs Hopson, Jr.
3217.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Life Of Iconic Vicksburg Physician Dr. William Briggs Hopson, Jr., A Pillar In The Mississippi Health-care Community, And Extending The Deepest Sympathy Of The Mississippi Legislature To His Family.

3218.title: Commend career and distinguished service of Dr. Clyde Muse upon the occasion of his retirement.
3218.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Service Of Dr. Vernon Clyde Muse As President Of Hinds Community College And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement On June 30, 2020, After 42 Years Of Outstanding Service.

3219.title: Suspend rules for drafting, introduction, etc; provide for state program for medical marijuana.
3219.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Establish The "mississippi Medical Marijuana Act"; To Define Terms; To Require The State Department Of Health To Promulgate Rules Relating To A Physician's Recommendation Of Medical Marijuana; To Require The Board Of Pharmacy To Promulgate Rules Relating To The Dispensing Of Medical Marijuana; To Require The Board Of Pharmacy To Develop An Annual, Nontransferable Specialty License For A Pharmacy To Dispense Recommended Marijuana; To Authorize Physicians To Recommend Marijuana For Medical Use By Patients Who Are Clinically Diagnosed As Suffering From A Chronic, Debilitating Medical Condition And With Whom The Physician Shares A Bona Fide Doctor-patient Relationship; To Require Pharmacists To Dispense Medical Marijuana In Person; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Medical Use Of Marijuana From Criminal Penalties Under The Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes."

3220.title: Mourn the passing of former Senator Bob M. Dearing of Natchez, Mississippi, and commend his public and charitable service.
3220.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Deepest Sympathy Of The Legislature To The Bereaved Family Of Former Senator Bob M. Dearing Of Natchez, Mississippi, And Paying Tribute To His Career Of Public And Charitable Service.

3221.title: Commemorate the life of Representative John Lewis.
3221.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Paying Tribute To Representative John Robert Lewis, Longtime United States Congressman And Civil Rights Advocate, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature To His Bereaved Family.
